responsibilities: Introducing Tookitaki Tookitaki is providing machine learning-powered enterprise solutions to address regulatory compliance problems in the financial services sector. Incorporated in November 2014 in Singapore, the company is led by a core team with cumulative 30-years‚Äô experience in finance, AI and big data analytics. Backed by institutional investors such as Jungle Ventures and Spring Seeds (a subsidiary of the Singapore Government), the company‚Äôs accolades include:  We are among the selected 21 companies which got accreditation from the government of Singapore for their stringent technology, finance and operations due diligence (www.imda.gov.sg/industry-development/programmes-and-grants/startups/accreditation-at-sgd) We won the first place in the MAS FinTech Awards (Singapore SME) in the regulatory compliance space from the Monetary Authority of Singapore for our approach to make the workflows in AML and Reconciliation scalable and highly auditable (beyond ML based black box approach) (www.mas.gov.sg/News-and-Publications/Media-Releases/2016/Ten-FinTech-companies-recognised-for-innovative-solutions-at-inaugural-FinTech-Awards.aspx) We are voted as one of the top 21 AI start-ups focusing on the financial services space by medici (www.letstalkpayments.com/medici-top-21-ai-companies/) We graduated from Nomura's corporate innovation program in November 2017 where we successfully delivered our product ‚Äì Reconciliation Management Suite ‚Äì in a pilot environment (https://inc42.com/buzz/nomura-voyager-fintech-accelerator-voyager-demo-day/)  In regulatory compliance, we focus on anti-money laundering and reconciliation and our products ‚Äì Alerts Management Suite (AMS) and Reconciliation Management Suite (RMS) ‚Äì cater to these areas, respectively. The mission or goal is to achieve 40% operational efficiency with significant savings in infrastructure and operational costs. ¬† Tookitaki's unique selling proposition (USP) is in our approach where we combine our proprietary modelling technique with our complete auditable framework to make the process dynamic and highly explainable (moving out of the black box approach). Moreover, our flexible on-premise and cloud-packaging capabilities, along with the option of easy integration to exiting core-banking applications (REST API end points), make the solution deployment faster with lesser barrier to entry. Today, regulatory compliance processes have become more complex and fluidic, increasing the chances for rule-based models to fail. Banks need to move beyond static rule-based systems and adopt a new approach to prevent financial and reputation loss. Tookitaki bridges the gap with its innovative software products ‚Äì AMS, RMS and PMS. ¬†
requirements: Role: DevOps Engineer Location: Singapore¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† Engineering @ Tookitaki The engineering team is responsible for building a robust predictive platform, which can add significant value to the BFSI vertical in solving operational and compliance risk problems. We take pride in building the system right and continuously evolving it. You have the freedom to choose right tools for the task. We encourage our engineers to participate in and contribute to open-source communities. Our Ideal Candidate Our engineering team is looking for We are looking for a Senior DevOps engineer to join the engineering team and help us automate the build, release, packaging and infrastructure provisioning and support processes. The candidate is expected to own the full life-cycle of provisioning, configuration management, monitoring, maintenance and support for cloud as well as on-premise deployments.  5-plus years of DevOps experience managing the Big Data application stack including HDFS, YARN, Spark, Hive and Hbase Deeper understanding of all the configurations required for installing and maintaining the infrastructure in the long run Experience setting up high availability, configuring resource allocation, setting up capacity schedulers, handling data recovery tasks Experience with middle-layer technologies including web servers (httpd, ningx), application servers (Jboss, Tomcat) and database systems (postgres, mysql) Experience setting up enterprise security solutions including setting up active directories, firewalls, SSL certificates, Kerberos KDC servers, etc. Experience maintaining and hardening the infrastructure by regularly applying required security packages and patches Experience supporting on-premise solutions as well as on AWS cloud Experience working with and supporting Spark-based applications on YARN Experience with one or more automation tools such as Ansible, Teraform, etc Experience working with CI/CD tools like Jenkins and various test report and coverage plugins Experience defining and automating the build, versioning and release processes for complex enterprise products Experience supporting clients remotely and on-site Experience working with and supporting Java- and Python-based tech stacks would be a Plus  Desired Non-technical   Very strong communication skills both written and verbal Strong desire to work with start-ups Must be a team player  Job Perks  Attractive variable compensation package Flexible working hours - everything is results-oriented Opportunity to work with an award-winning organization in the hottest space in tech - artificial intelligence and advanced machine learning

responsibilities: About¬†Institute for Infocomm Research (I¬≤R)  The Institute for Infocomm Research (I¬≤R) is a member of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) family and is Singapore‚Äôs largest ICT research institute. Our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualisation solutions. For more information about I¬≤R, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sgÔªø We are looking for strong candidates in the field of Artificial intelligence and deep learning, with an interest in working on both fundamental algorithms in large-scale machine learning or deep learning, and also applying it to practical problems in vertical domains. The position, based within the Program in Artificial Intelligence at I2R, entails working closely with a highly interdisciplinary team of researchers with training from leading universities like MIT, Stanford and CMU. Listed below are problems of interest in the Deep Learning 2.0 project: Multimodal Deep Learning: Towards effective learning from heterogeneous data sources Currently, deep learning is applied in various areas such as visual computing, speech recognition, text mining, etc. In each area, the learning model is trained with large amounts of data in isolation. A multimodal learning approach from heterogeneous data sources, including video, speech, text, etc. is necessary to achieve breakthrough in performance. Unsupervised Deep Learning: Towards 10X fewer labeled samples Labeling large amounts of training data is one of the most time-consuming steps in the deep learning pipeline, and is often not feasible. The aim is to achieve the same performance with 10x fewer labeled training samples. This is a strong step in the direction of unsupervised deep learning, where representations are learnt with large amounts of unlabeled unstructured data. Deep Learning on Embedded Devices: Towards 100X smaller models Current deep learning models have 10s of millions of neurons, making it infeasible for deployment on mobile and embedded hardware. The aim is to achieve models that are 100x smaller, with little loss in performance. This capability will also be critical for emerging neuromorphic platforms, where the number of spiking neurons is orders of magnitude smaller than in current state-of-the-art deep learning models. Online Deep Learning: Towards Near Real Time (NRT) model updates State-of-the-art deep learning models still take several days to train on expensive GPU infrastructure. A common problem is when new data (including new classes) are constantly added to an evolving, always-learning system. Algorithms to move towards real-time updates will be essential. Extreme Deep Learning: Training 1B neural networks efficiently The high model capacity of deep networks is why increasing amounts of data and model size improves performance. However, there are substantial challenges in hardware and algorithms challenges in training very large models efficiently. The aim is to address these challenges to achieve more efficient training. Deep Learning for Spoken Language Processing and Natural Language Understanding: Towards better modelling of human communication Language technology has made great advances through deep learning in the past five years, penetrating fields such as speech recognition and machine translation. However, there are still numerous challenges that need to be addressed, ranging from the requirement of specialized linguistic resources to large amounts of annotated data, and to insufficient theoretical grounding in deep learning. This aim attempts to address challenges that are often overlooked by major commercial AI players. White-Box Deep Learning: Towards interpretable and contextually informed models Current deep learning models are largely black-boxes that are not informed by contextual relations and provide little intuition. Improved abilities to regulate the learning process, and interpret the resulting predictions will be essential for the next wave of AI applications -- especially for complex learning scenarios and applications involving critical decisions. Incorporating Knowledge Graphs into Deep Learning: Towards better understanding of images Current deep learning systems today have no real understanding of images, with output typically a bunch of bounding boxes, learnt using a large number of label or sentence-level associations. Knowledge graphs like the MIT ConceptNet will be used to understand higher level semantics and relationships between entities, to improve classification accuracy. ¬† ¬†
requirements: ¬†  Minimum Bachelor in¬†Computer Science, Statistics, or Data Science intensive fields, with expertise in one or more of the following areas:     Large-scale machine learning Deep learning, supervised or unsupervised Applying state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to practical problems in different domains   Experience in corporate or application oriented environments is a plus Ability to work independently, as well as in teams highly desired Good communication skills for proposals, reports, and publications Strong programming abilities (e.g. Perl, Bash, C/C++, Java, Python, R, MATLAB) Computer vision and deep learning skills desirable  The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified

responsibilities: About Dathena Science Dathena is a Swiss and Singaporean company developing data governance software based on machine learning algorithms. Dathena is the most complete and accurate data governance platform and is the only solution to easily classify and manage data with this level of accuracy while helping companies to comply with regulations. Using cutting edge machine learning technology, Dathena sift through all unstructured data allowing to regain full control on company‚Äôs information. responsibilities: The project focuses on optimizing medical resource and appointment scheduling. The project aims to develop patient and resource models for medical appointment scheduling, and design intelligent methods and strategies for scheduling medical appointments and resources with various optimization criteria. We aim to model the treatment plans of patients as workflows and exploit workflow scheduling algorithms in distributed computing for scheduling medical resources and appointments in a coordinated and intelligent manner. We also aim to exploit data analytics, machine learning and advanced simulation techniques to predict uncertainty in medical appointments and develop robust scheduling algorithms for achieving high patient throughput while minimizing demand spikes.

responsibilities: Who are we: Hubble is a technology startup focused on revolutionising the Construction Industry. The Construction industry undertakes the world‚Äôs largest, most expensive, and complex projects ever dreamt of by mankind. Yet, the Construction industry is notoriously slow to adopt new technologies and as a result, there exists a large amount of inefficiencies and problems that Hubble can create positive value and make a great impact on. This impacts the homes people live in, offices people work in, and cities generations live in. There is no other industry where technology can have a greater impact. Bar none. Hubble‚Äôs vision is to build the pillars of trust for the Construction industry and we are on a mission to develop the autonomous self-building construction sites of tomorrow - powered by big data, machine learning, and artificial intelligence.. Our first step to our mission is to track the Man, Machine, Material, and Money (4M) data - for the Construction industry. The 4M data can be used to optimise operations at the worksites as well as to build an automated trading platform for the 4M. We have grown rapidly to become the market leader in each of the 4M verticals: 1. Man: We have more than 10,000 construction workers (~5% market share) on Hubble's platform and have tracked more than 35 million man-hours in total. 2. Machine: We track more than 1.5 million machinery transactions/year and have >US$100 million worth of machinery on Hubble's platform today. 3. Material: We developed Hubble Maps (Patent Pending) for precise indoor material and man tracking. We were awarded BCA's Innovation Grant 2018 and presented our technology to DPM Teo Chee Hean. 4. Money: We are deployed at iconic projects such as Project Jewel, Paya Lebar Quarters, Gardens by the Bay, and City Gate and have tracked more than $1 billion in project value. Interesting fact: We have grown rapidly without any venture funding to become the market leader in this space in less than 1 year. Our partners include the largest and most prestigious Construction companies such as Woh Hup, Lum Chang, Hexacon, Erect Group, Koh Kock Leong Enterprise, Chuan Lim Construction, and OAS Painting and Construction. We have also built the best engineering, product, and business team comprising the best and brightest of Singapore. We are a collegial set up and are extremely collaborative. We are hiring aggressively and are looking for motivated, smart, driven, and resourceful people to join our team. Who will you be working with: If you connect with any of the description below, please apply immediately:  Purpose driven Hungry, ambitions, and self-motivated Meritocratic, results/performance > age/bureaucracy Resourceful, independent, chart our own destiny Determined, perseverance, and hard working Creative, innovative, out of the box  Yes, the above is everyone of us at Hubble. What will you be doing:  Developing a clean and maintainable code using software engineering best-practices and modern platforms. Leading full product development lifecycle from ideation to live production Day-to-day tech operations such as server maintenance and deployment.
requirements: What skill sets do you need:  Have a good understanding of web application architecture (REST & JWT) Experience in implementing various software engineering design patterns Good working knowledge in one or more of these frameworks: Ruby on Rails, AngularJS, ReactJS, and React Native Familiar with Git Experience in DevOps and in building scalable products will be an added advantage. Comfortable with working in a fast-paced environment and highly collaborative team to solve real business problems Versatility and enthusiasm to tackle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward Applicants with leadership qualities will be an added benefit

responsibilities: About Us Our ambitious goal of helping innovators build a better world with data started in 2009. Today, we are one of the fastest growing enterprise companies in history, surpassing $1B in revenue at the end of 2017. The world is experiencing a technological revolution driven by AI, machine learning, virtual reality, quantum computing and self-driving cars -- all of which require large amounts of data and put Pure‚Äôs technology literally in the driver‚Äôs seat. Our solutions deliver real-time, secure data to power mission-critical production, DevOps, and modern analytics in multi-cloud environments. With a Satmetrix NPS score in the top 1% of B2B companies worldwide, our customer-first culture and commitment to innovation create a thriving company that employees, customers, partners, and investors love. For more information on our business, check out the corporate fact sheet here. Digital Marketing Team at Pure The Pure Storage Global Digital Marketing team is focused on supporting hyper growth, geographic expansion, and delivering world-class, dynamic, and intelligent online experiences that engage and delight our prospects, customers, partners, and employees globally. The team is focused on optimising every digital touchpoint and conversion trigger to grow revenue. We‚Äôre looking for a passionate digital marketing leader for our innovative Digital Marketing team. The team is responsible for global paid and organic search, paid media, social media marketing, purestorage.com and the digital analytics that ties it all together. The Digital Marketing team will also be responsible for capturing demand gen best practices and piloting innovation opportunities for marketing. This individual will be responsible for planning and optimising Pure‚Äôs paid digital media, demand generation, and the company‚Äôs social media programmes in APJ (Asia-Pacific and Japan). In this role, you will support our efforts to drive demand and multi-million-dollar pipeline through APJ paid media, social media, and web experiences optimised to accelerate conversions and drive incremental revenue. You will oversee and manage social and media agency relationships and be responsible for working with agency partners and Pure‚Äô analytics suite to track and report on digital media performance. You will work closely with the global digital marketing team, theater program marketing, and field marketing to develop a digital media strategy that aligns with business goals and drives demand for the theatre. We are looking for a team member who has a proven track record of rolling up their sleeves to get the work done, thrives on analysis to refine how to optimise and has a global mindset. This role will pioneer new approaches and tactics by contributing to enterprise-wide digital strategies, and new approaches to brand storytelling.¬† This position is based in Singapore or Tokyo, Japan and will report to the Head of the Global Demand Centre. What You Will Be Doing WEB?  Collaborate with APJ programs and field marketing teams on the strategy and planning of APJ digital media programmes including paid search, programmatic media, and retargeting, paid & organic social, and content syndication. Work with appointed media and social agencies to lead the execution, reporting, and ongoing optimisation of these media programmes. Design and execute digital media plans that are aligned with the prospect and/or customer‚Äôs journey Work closely with colleagues in the Global Demand Center to define audience segmentation needs for the theatre, plan and execute targeted programs using data intelligence, track digital lead quality and provide feedback on BoM for digital activities. Work with agencies and internal analytics to set-up digital tracking needs and consolidate reporting to showcase digital media performance for the APJ theater. Work hands-on with the Pure Storage ‚Äúmarchitecture‚Äù in the region. Currently including (not limited to) SFDC, Tableau, Adobe Analytics & Marketo. Partner with key stakeholders, including APJ Leadership and field marketing managers, Digital Team, Product Marketing, Campaigns, Partner, Customer References and Corporate teams to ensure purestorage.com is optimised as a frictionless, localised and personalised experience to accelerate conversions and deliver measurable business results in APJ.
requirements: What You Bring To The Team  Proven work experience managing paid digital media and organic social media programmes in the B2B technology space and across APJ markets and an understanding of how to leverage paid, earned and owned media Experience with account-based marketing, and using data intelligence to deliver targeted activities to various audience segments Experience driving B2B demand generation in APJ markets. Experience with Japan market is a must. Demonstrated experience in successfully executing a social programme that includes growing followers organically, increasing engagements, and demand gen. conversions Strong project management skills with proven track record of delivering high-quality work under tight timelines Self-motivated and takes initiative; can work independently on multiple projects at once and has the ability to demonstrate sound decision-making and react quickly under pressure Demonstrated track record of leveraging data-driven research/analysis to drive strategic direction and website optimisation Solid knowledge of SEO and keyword research BS/BA degree required 8-10 years of digital and social media media experience and/or digital marketing strategy and execution management  Pure creates opportunities for your development and career growth. At Pure, we believe that each Puritan is a leader contributing to the success of our business, regardless of role. We offer an assortment of learning options available to all Puritans, including workshops on leadership, management, career development and more! We‚Äôre here to change the world and we hope you join us! Popular Perks Our rewards philosophy is tailored to provide Puritans globally competitive compensation and benefit programmes that enable innovation and growth. We offer a wide variety of benefits and perks including comprehensive medical insurance, meal service, opportunities to attend events, join sports leagues, employee assistance programme, work-life services, travel assistance, and employee resource groups ‚Äì all of which are thoughtfully designed to maintain mind and body wellness. Through our Pure Good Foundation, we also offer numerous volunteer opportunities for employees to give back across the globe.

Extensive Python and web service development experience and team leadership skills are a must. responsibilities: JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.8 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the worlds most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at www.jpmorganchase.com. ¬† ¬† ¬† Our group:  ¬† The Compliance Analytics Group (CA) is responsible for statistical and data analytic efforts to improve the scale and performance of JPMC‚Äôs regulatory controls relating to Anti Money Laundering (AML), Trade Surveillance, Sanctions Screening, Know Your Customer (KYC), Client Due Diligence (CDD) and other forms of financial crimes monitoring. ¬† ¬† ¬† The Group plays a global role, engaging with major stakeholders in all of JPMC‚Äôs lines of business and countries of operation, including Business Compliance, Operations, Model Review and Technology. ¬† ¬† ¬† Our work includes developing statistical models to identify suspicious and high risk activity across JPMC‚Äôs highly diverse customer base. This is a fast developing space and requires a combination of analytical creativity, mathematical and statistical skills, and analytical execution experience on large datasets. ¬† ¬† ¬† Description:  ¬† We are seeking a suitable candidate with solid experience in application development, maintenance and deployment in data analytics domain to play a key role in our development of quantitative tools and analytics to guide the bank‚Äôs monitoring activities. ¬† ¬† ¬† Major responsibilities and skills include: ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†  Development, maintenance and deployment of quantitative tools ¬†and delivery for projects, this requires:  Demonstrated experience in development and deployment of in-house analytics applications Ability to quickly learn and adopt to new programming languages in a fast changing environment Ability to identify and automate repetitive tasks a good understanding of machine learning & data analytical techniques Support data scientists to design, code, train, test, deploy, and iterate on machine learning systems Ability to assimilate large amounts of data from multiple sources, and create clear summaries. Documentation of all code / analysis in an organized, clear manner Willingness to contribute to colleagues‚Äô projects that are not directly assigned to the individual    ¬† ¬†   Engaging a group of senior leaders in the US to drive decisions for JPMC Corporate Compliance; critical skills are:       Good communication, both verbal and written   Summarizing technical ideas in business-friendly language     ¬†   Developing subject matter expertise in JPMC products, services and clients   Understand the Compliance dimensions, and sources of relevant customer and transaction data     ¬† ¬†

responsibilities: T√úV S√úD is an international service corporation and a world leader in consulting, testing, certification, and training. Headquartered in Munich, Germany, T√úV S√úD, employs more than 24,000 professionals across 850 offices in more than 50 countries around the globe. In line with Singapore‚Äôs Smart Nation initiative, T√úV S√úD setup a global Center of Excellence (CoE) Digital Service in Singapore to drive the development of new services and businesses in our customers‚Äô sectors and future markets. For our strategic development of ‚ÄúContinuous Certification‚Äù we are currently looking for a highly skilled senior software architect to lead implementation efforts of new tools and machine learning algorithms in the domains of ‚ÄòSmart City‚Äô, ‚ÄòSmart Equipment‚Äô, and ‚ÄòIndustrie 4.0‚Äô. We offer the unique opportunity to work with world leaders at the forefront of smart digital systems, shaping the way people use rely on technology. The team of the CoE embodies the spirit of a dynamic ‚Äòstart-up‚Äô environment, but backed with reliability and strength of an MNC. ¬† Position Summary The Centre of Excellence Singapore is a key driver of T√úV S√úDs international digital initiative. The successful candidate will take a leading role in the development of novel tools and services under the strategic thrust of smart inspection and the domain of visual analytics. Visual inspection takes a key role in typical inspection workflows. Automation of visual inspection holds the promise to increase productivity, reduce risk, and enable novel inspection services. responsibilities: Project Name: Unattended Ground Sensors Research Fellow position available in School of EEE, NTU for industry sponsored project for developing neuromorphic embedded system for image recognition. Established in 1981, the SCHOOL OF ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONIC ENGINEERING (EEE) http://www.eee.ntu.edu.sg is one of the founding Schools of the Nanyang Technological University. Built on a culture of excellence, the School is renowned for its high academic standards and research. With more than 150 faculty members and an enrolment of more than 4,000, of which about 1,000 are graduate students, it is one of the largest EEE schools in the world and ranks 6th in the field of Electrical & Electronic Engineering in the 2017 QS World University Rankings by Subjects. ¬† The position is in the BRAIN lab (http://www3.ntu.edu.sg/home/arindam.basu/ ) under the supervision of Dr. Arindam Basu. Selected candidate has to lead in system integration of custom machine learning ELM IC with neuromorphic camera and FPGA platform. He/she will get to work with cutting edge neuromorphic image sensors and develop one of the lowest power machine learning chips in the world. The candidate will get the chance to use this chip for video processing and develop new generations of this design with ample opportunity for basic research as well as commercialization through startup.  Main job is to write Verilog/VHDL codes for interfacing FPGA with custom ELM IC developed by team and neuromorphic image sensor Develop library of Verilog/VHDL codes for basic image processing blocks and neural networks Need to co-work with algorithm person to optimize the neural network for hardware friendly implementation  Application Procedure: Please email a CV and any other relevant documents to arindam.basu@ntu.edu.sg clearly mentioning the project name, job field and job position applied for. Email subject should include UGS_2_RF and all attachments to email be named as UGS_2_RF_*. ¬†Also mention in email earliest date when you can join and intended period of stay. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified for interview.
requirements: Education: PhD in EE/ECE/CSE ¬† Must have:  Experience in HDL coding, using FPGA kits and interfacing FPGA with computer and other components Knowledge of Neural Networks and mapping neural networks to digital systems  ¬† Good to have:  Knowledge of debugging using logic analyser  ¬† We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

responsibilities: Introducing Tookitaki Tookitaki is providing machine learning-powered enterprise solutions to address regulatory compliance problems in the financial services sector. Incorporated in November 2014 in Singapore, the company is led by a core team with cumulative 30-years‚Äô experience in finance, AI and big data analytics. Backed by institutional investors such as Jungle Ventures and Spring Seeds (a subsidiary of the Singapore Government), the company‚Äôs accolades include:   We are among the selected 21 companies which got accreditation from the government of Singapore for their stringent technology, finance and operations due diligence (www.imda.gov.sg/industry-development/programmes-and- grants/startups/accreditation-at-sgd)   We won the first place in the MAS FinTech Awards (Singapore SME) in the regulatory compliance space from the Monetary Authority of Singapore for our approach to make the workflows in AML and Reconciliation scalable and highly auditable (beyond ML based black box approach) (www.mas.gov.sg/News-and-Publications/Media- Releases/2016/Ten-FinTech-companies-recognised-for-innovative-solutions-at- inaugural-FinTech-Awards.aspx)   We are voted as one of the top 21 AI start-ups focusing on the financial services space by medici (www.letstalkpayments.com/medici-top-21-ai-companies/)   We graduated from Nomura's corporate innovation program in November 2017 where we successfully delivered our product ‚Äì Reconciliation Management Suite ‚Äì in a pilot environment (https://inc42.com/buzz/nomura-voyager-fintech-accelerator-voyager- demo-day/) In regulatory compliance, we focus on anti-money laundering and reconciliation and our products ‚Äì Alerts Management Suite (AMS) and Reconciliation Management Suite (RMS) ‚Äì cater to these areas, respectively. The mission or goal is to achieve 40% operational efficiency with significant savings in infrastructure and operational costs. Tookitaki's unique selling proposition (USP) is in our approach where we combine our proprietary modelling technique with our complete auditable framework to make the process dynamic and highly explainable (moving out of the black box approach). Moreover, our flexible on-premise and cloud-packaging capabilities, along with the option of easy integration to exiting core-banking applications (REST API end points), make the solution deployment faster with lesser barrier to entry. Today, regulatory compliance processes have become more complex and fluidic, increasing the chances for rule-based models to fail. Banks need to move beyond static rule-based systems and adopt a new approach to prevent financial and reputation loss. Tookitaki bridges the gap with its innovative software products ‚Äì AMS, RMS and PMS.   careeers@tookitaki.com
requirements: Engineering/Research@Tookitaki The engineering/research team is responsible for building a robust predictive platform, which can add significant value to the BFSI vertical in solving operational and compliance risk problems. We take pride in building the system right and continuously evolving it. You have the freedom to choose right tools for the task. We encourage our engineers to participate in and contribute to open-source communities. Our Ideal Candidate Our engineering/research team is looking for a Lead Researcher with 6+ years‚Äô solid research experience, who:   Is abreast with the state-of-the-art solutions related to evolving ML areas like Auto ML, explainable and interpretable ML, and online continuous learning.   Has deep interest and experience working on open-ended research problems in machine learning.   Would like to spend the next few years in implementing research ideas into product features to make an industry-wide impact.   Is well versed with computer science skills required to implement the algorithms on big data sets.   Has experience in parallelizing traditional algorithms to leverage advanced computing infrastructure and distributed systems.   Enjoys publishing research findings and presenting them at advanced ML conferences.   Would like to constantly experiment with new research ideas, find its applicability with our products to push the boundary forward. Desired Non-technical      Very strong communication skills both written and verbal   Strong desire to work with startups   Must be a team player Job Perks     Attractive variable compensation package   Flexible working hours - everything is results-oriented   Opportunity to work with an award-winning organization in the hottest technology spaces -- artificial intelligence and advanced machine learning

responsibilities: Established in 1981, the SCHOOL OF ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONIC ENGINEERING (EEE) http://www.eee.ntu.edu.sg is one of the founding Schools of the Nanyang Technological University. With more than 150 faculty members and an enrolment of more than 4,000, of which about 1,000 are graduate students, it is one of the largest EEE schools in the world and ranks 6th in the field of Electrical & Electronic Engineering in the 2017 QS World University Rankings by Subjects. Job¬†Description: A Research Associate position is available in the School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering at Nanyang Technological University. This position is for detecting high frequency signals of unknown bandwidths received from a wideband antenna array. Modulation types of the received signals have to be identified. Multiple signals with diverse modulation and bandwidth characteristics can be present in the detected signals. Machine learning algorithms have to be developed to solve the above listed tasks. Training data is expected to have known as well as unknown signals too.
requirements: Master's Degree in a relevant field. Research experiences in machine learning algorithm development is essential. responsibilities: Company overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don‚Äôt intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world‚Äôs most successful organizations ‚Äì a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind ‚Äì but even as we continue to grow, we‚Äôre committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Global Clients & Agency Solutions Our Global Clients & Agency Solutions team helps serve some of the world's largest brands. Our dedicated teams of marketing and advertising specialists use their unique skill sets to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We aspire to advise our clients on all aspects of their online business strategy. Using Google's broad range of products, we help our clients connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences. The role: Unskippable Labs Experimentation Lead - Singapore Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users. Additional Role Description: Unskippable Labs' vision is to provide leading-edge guidance on vertically-driven ad campaign effectiveness through global scaled experimentation and analysis driven by machine learning and activated through flexible engagements with key Global Client and Agency Solutions (GCAS) and Large Customer Sales (LCS) clients to evolve their advertising on our platforms and beyond.  As the Unskippable Labs Experimentation Lead , you will help shape the Unskippable Lab‚Äôs Experimentation agenda for Asia-Pacific (APAC) and lead client engagements to educate them on our understanding of how ads and attention are evolving. You will apply knowledge from existing experimentation to our customers; creative assets, identify the right experiment opportunities, clearly defining the hypotheses, setting up the experiment, and distilling it down into actionable insights. You will also be responsible for managing the Unskippable team in APAC. In this role, you will work with the Advanced Brand Acceleration Ads Intelligence team to develop new templates and reporting dashboards that enable sellers to do their analyses of experiments. Responsibilities: - Consult on creative assets of opportunities with clients and their agencies. Present key creative and vertical narratives and identify experimentation opportunities against the areas outlined by the team. - Develop hypotheses for experimentation and lead the pitch with clients. Work with the creative strategist and agencies on the development of the test assets. - Lead the analysis and interpretation of results and insights across all experiments. Scale learnings internally with other APAC teams. - Lead recruitment of the Unskippable Army and manage regular trainings and connects. Work closely with the APAC Experiments team. - Connect regularly with the experimentation leads in other Unskippable Lab centres, share learnings, and share best practices for the APAC team. Liaise with the ABAT Ad Intelligence team to leverage scalable templates and tools.
requirements: Minimum qualifications: - 3 years of experience in a video specialist and/or analytical role. - Experience with Google and YouTube media and measurement solutions products. Preferred qualifications: - Experience as a video specialist, analytical lead, or Account Strategist in LCS or Global Client and Agency Solutions (GCAS). - Experience as an account manager and video technologies. - Able to make recommendations for clients about how to best use Google/YouTube media and measurement products. - Ability to craft stories from data, frame hypotheses, and mine data and insights around creative effectiveness. Ability to craft presentations for clients. - Ability to identify opportunities comfortably speaking in front of executive audiences. - Interest about how ads work. Excellent business judgment, analytical, and presentation skills.

To support the development of Machine to machine communications with the support of domain experts in the field. To perform research on smart manufacturing concepts applied to the FMCG domain and its related processes with the support of experts in the field who will be providing ground knowledge to interpret results from the data mining and machine learning activities. To lead the writing of technical reports and presentations of technical results.

Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users. Additional Role Description: Unskippable Labs vision: to provide leading-edge guidance on vertically-driven ad campaign effectiveness through global scaled experimentation and analysis driven by machine learning and activated through flexible engagements with key GCAS and LCS clients to evolve their advertising on our platforms and beyond.  This role will lead creative guidance as a part of the Unskippable Labs center team in partnership with insights and product/brand specialists. You will be the creative thought leader within your region, team and vertical. You will also diagnose opportunities for improving creative effectiveness in video and implement them in partnership with clients and agencies. Responsibilities: - Develop the core creative guidance for ad effectiveness across formats in partnership with media and product specialists. - Deliver that guidance in compelling and actionable ways to executive creative and brand clients. - Provide effective feedback on creative during development from idea to storyboard to edited assets. - Develop new hypotheses for creative experimentation and explore them via both client and unbranded experimentation. - Partner with regional service teams to ensure cohesive guidance on ad effectiveness recommendations.
requirements: Minimum qualifications: - BA/BS degree in a related field, or equivalent practical experience. - 7 years of experience in creative strategy with demonstrated expertise in digital video. Preferred qualifications: - Experience working across brand verticals and geographies. - Ability to create effective ads, from initial idea through final edit. - Developed writing, pitch-crafting and presenting skills.

jobtitle: Abuse Analyst, Real Time Communications - Singapore
responsibilities: Company overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don‚Äôt intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world‚Äôs most successful organizations ‚Äì a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind ‚Äì but even as we continue to grow, we‚Äôre committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Trust & Safety At Google we work hard to earn our users‚Äô trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google‚Äôs team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google‚Äôs products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages. The role: Abuse Analyst, Real Time Communications - Singapore Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what‚Äôs right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety. Additional Role Description: Our Trust & Safety team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users and ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products. The Trust and Safety Real Time Communications (RTC) team‚Äôs mission is to stop abusers from exploiting the gaps on our RTC products.¬†  As an Abuse Analyst you will help us uncovering complex abuse issues, using machine learning and analytics and working closely with our engineering partners. You will understand the user's point of view and leverage big-picture thinking, strategic leadership, and technical skills to ensure their safety and meet their needs. In this role, you will work globally and cross-functionally with Product Managers and engineering partners to navigate challenging online safety situations and quickly handle abuse and fraud cases. Responsibilities: - Develop anti-abuse programs to solve for cross-product vulnerabilities and ensure successful global roll-outs. Design countermeasures for attacks across various client properties. - Analyze metrics, dig into underlying vulnerabilities, and design solutions. Represent the abuse team in cross-functional, cross-product area conversations with teams around the company, advising on counter-abuse strategies and coordinating integration efforts. - Develop and deploy machine learning models collaborating with Engineering partners to solve fraud/abuse problems at scale. - Define workflow processes for manual reviews and machine learning labels. Collaborate with Product, Design, Legal, Policy, and Industry partners to advance the state-of-the-art across the Internet as a whole. - Align cross-functional teams toward a common, measurable goal.
requirements: Minimum qualifications: - Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or related technical field. - Experience deriving abuse signals and conclusions from data. - Experience summarizing data. - Experience facilitating automation and prevention processes. Preferred qualifications: - Experience in a technical role (e.g., Data Scientist, Quantitative Analyst, Technical Program Manager, Engineer). - Experience developing machine learning models. Experience in one or more programming language (e.g., Python, Java, C++). - Experience in statistics, working with statistical packages (e.g., R, SAS, Matlab) and large datasets (SQL). - Experience delivering projects that involve multiple cross-functional stakeholders across geographies. - Experience with fraud/abuse investigations, fraud/risk management, and security and threat analysis in the context of Internet-related products/activities. - Ability to work remotely and maintain excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

responsibilities: The School of Business (SBIZ) at Singapore University of Social Sciences¬†aims to educate business minds and in the process, transform the lives of our students when they graduate with a business degree. SBIZ currently has more than 4,000 students enrolled in various degree programmes. ¬† Our students are mainly working adults who are keen to upgrade and remain competitive in the fast-paced business world. We also have a sizable group of full-time students pursuing their degree education full time in the University.¬†To equip our students for a better future, we provide them with a curriculum that is industry-relevant and we adopt innovative and practice-oriented pedagogical approaches (e.g. case study, flipped-classroom). Classes are interactive in nature and instructors go beyond lectures and facilitate interactive discussions and activities that require application of theories to solve real world problems. As most of our students are working, they are able to apply what they have learnt in the classroom to real-life scenarios in their workplace almost immediately. This enables them to live out our maxim - Learn Today, Apply Tomorrow. ¬† SBIZ is now recruiting passionate full-time faculty members who are aligned with our education aspirations. The responsibilities of SBIZ full-time faculty members include teaching and developing courses, conducting academic and/or applied research, and managing degree programmes and projects. We are interested in candidates in the following areas: ¬†  Accountancy (especially in the areas of Financial Accounting, Managerial Accounting, Assurance, Taxation, Business Valuation and Accounting Theory)¬† Analytics (especially in the areas of Machine Learning, Data Mining, Text Mining, Statistics, Forecasting, Optimisation, Data Visualisation, Data Management, IoT and Big Data) Business Law Entrepreneurship¬† Finance Information Systems Project Management Quality Management Supply Chain Management (especially in the areas of Procurement and International Trade ¬†System) Strategy Operations Management Customer Relationship¬†Management Business excellence (especially in the area of SPRING Singapore's Business Excellence framework)
requirements: Ph.D. degree holder in a relevant discipline. Ph.D candidates nearing completion will also be considered. Candidate with teaching and/or working experience in the relevant area will have an added advantage. In the area of Finance, candidates with a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) qualification or those in the area of Fintech, crytocurrency and digital banking will have an added advantage. In the area of Accountancy, candidates with a Chartered Accountant of Singapore qualification (or equivalent professional qualification) and at least a Master's degree in a relevant area will also be considered.¬† In the area of Business Law, candidates with a Bachelor's degree in Law and at least 5 years of relevant working experience will also be considered.  ¬† For more information and application, please visit our website:¬†http://www.suss.edu.sg/careers/appointments-vacancies/Pages/Academic-Appointments-(Full-time).aspx (Only shortlisted candidates will be notified)

responsibilities: The Solar Energy Research Institute of Singapore (SERIS) is Singapore‚Äôs national institute for applied solar energy research. SERIS conducts industry-oriented research and development as well as use-inspired basic research in the field of solar energy conversion. The institute collaborates closely with universities, research organisations, government agencies and industry, both locally and globally. The collaborations with companies from the global solar sector span from small startups to industry leading heavyweights. Job Scope: In view of recent developments, SERIS is currently looking for a high-calibre individual, with an outstanding drive towards innovation and applying deep-tech systems to the fields of energy meteorology and solar forecasting. He / She will conduct research activities and responsible for managing product and software development specifically in the area of sky cameras and sky imagers. Essential duties and responsibilities include the following (other duties may be assigned):  Further evolve the field of sky cameras and sky imagers for the application in operational solar forecasting Drive SERIS‚Äô in-house developments on sky cameras and sky imagers and design & implement new features and functionalities, which entails hardware & software development, field-testing & certification. Investigate on machine learning based forecasting models from the sky camera‚Äôs atmospheric observations. Develop the sky camera based system for monitoring the cloud coverage and cloud dynamics. Analyze radiance distributions and create 3-D solar insolation profiles. Work on techniques to estimate global, direct and diffuse irradiance. Evaluate market potential and assess the possibility to create a spin-off company for the SERIS‚Äô in-house developed sky camera.
requirements: PhD in Electrical Engineering with focus on power electronics and knowledge on embedded systems & micro-electronics. Know-how and experience in PV system technology, IoT (Internet of Things) applications, forecasting methodologies. Additional knowledge in meteorology and/or atmospheric physics is desirable Demonstrated significant scientific contributions in the form of top-tier journals papers and leading conference contributions. Candidates are expected to have hands-on experience in commercializing products from an ideation stage all the way until certification and market entry. Additional management degree is desirable. Proven excellent engineering and project management skills Demonstrated strong initiative and follow through in executing project initiatives, overcoming obstacles and balancing multiple priorities effectively with strong negotiation skills. Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment with engineers, consultants, regulators and customers. Highly motivated, well organized and can work efficiently both in teams as well as independently. Possess a passion for sustainable energy. Minimum 4 - 5 years of experience

responsibilities: About RedMart RedMart is Singapore's largest online grocery marketplace. We are a part of Alibaba-backed Lazada, Southeast Asia‚Äôs leading online shopping and selling platform. Our online marketplace offers over 100,000 grocery and household essentials items with the convenience of home delivery 7 days a week. Our mission is to save people time and money for the important things in life. We are a fast growing, tech-powered company with an awesome culture (see our culture deck). We have great tech teams in Singapore and Bangalore. We work on a wide range of areas: consumer-facing mobile and web applications, search, recommendations, e-commerce, marketing automation, CRM, marketplace seller platform, supply chain automation, warehouse fulfilment and automation, transportation logistics and last mile delivery. If you are interested in being part of the team that is transforming the grocery business, helping people save time and money daily, solving interesting challenges, and working with smart and passionate people, we want to hear from you. Role Purpose At RedMart we use technology to delight our customers; we innovate to make our customers‚Äô lives better.¬†¬† As Engineering Manager - Transport you will be responsible for leading a software team building transport intelligence systems at RedMart. This team is responsible for optimising delivery efficiency while maintaining a high rate of on-time delivery and offering a variety of delivery options to our customers. The team will be based in Singapore.¬† ¬† As an Engineering Manager you will: ‚Ä¢ Lead a team of software engineers and data scientists that has full ownership of key parts of RedMart‚Äôs Last Mile Delivery platforms, such as routing and location intelligence. ‚Ä¢ Conceptualize and implement transportation and telematics products, apps, algorithms and data analytics to provide a fast, reliable, convenient delivery experience at financially sustainable costs.¬† ‚Ä¢ Set the technical architecture for the team and take an active role in defining the product roadmap.¬† ‚Ä¢ Be responsible for driving impact by delivering on key initiatives as well as technical and business KPIs. You‚Äôll be expected to make a significant impact on these through great technical judgment, business process understanding, close relationships with other technical leaders and your business counterparts, focused execution and frequent delivery. ‚Ä¢ Attract, develop and retain the best software engineers and data scientists. Help them innovate, make an impact, continually improve at their job and grow in their careers. ‚Ä¢ Champion engineering and operational excellence. Lead your team to design, implement, test and run in production robust, highly available automated routing solutions that our 24/7 store and operations can rely on.¬†¬† ‚Ä¢ Lead and contribute to cross-functional initiatives to improve engineering at RedMart. ‚Ä¢ Collaborate with other engineering leaders, product managers, and business counterparts to deliver company-wide initiatives. ‚Ä¢ Foster a culture of continuous improvement through mentoring, feedback, and metrics. ¬† What do we look for in a candidate? ‚Ä¢ Customer focus. Everything we do starts with our customers external and internal. ‚Ä¢ Impact. We are results oriented. We value people who focus on the right things and get them done. ‚Ä¢ Perseverance. Building a great company that customers love is hard work. Many challenges await and we are looking for team members we can count on when things get tough. ‚Ä¢ Ownership. We are looking for team members who are not only owners of their work but regard themselves as owners of the company as well. They are flexible in what they do and constantly seek out ways to have a greater impact on customers and our company.¬† ‚Ä¢ Breadth and depth of technology experience and strong technical and product judgment.¬† ‚Ä¢ Track record of building and leading great development teams through hiring and coaching.¬† ‚Ä¢ Track record of successfully delivering multi-stakeholder projects that marry technology, people, and processes.¬† ‚Ä¢ Machine Learning and Domain knowledge. Experience with building software for logistics, transportation or running Machine Learning and optimization systems in production is a must. ‚Ä¢ Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
requirements: We develop on a modern technology stack that focuses on enabling engineers to be productive and impactful. Engineers work in teams to determine their own release schedules; teams develop, release and operate their software independently. We are strong believers in automation: we use automation for continuous integration, testing, and delivery. Although we use Amazon Web Services, we use open source software where possible. We continuously add to and update our technology stack. ‚Ä¢ Microservices written in Java or Scala using Play Framework or Akka, and occasionally Python and NodeJS. ‚Ä¢ AngularJs for web apps. ‚Ä¢ Native apps use Objective C/Swift (iOS) and Java/Kotlin (Android), Fastlane, Calabash, Cocoapods/Gradle, JUnit, and occasionally hybrid React Native. ‚Ä¢ MongoDB, Cassandra, Hazelcast for storage. ‚Ä¢ RabbitMQ for messaging. ‚Ä¢ AWS infrastructure, with HAProxy, Nginx, Redis. Chef deployments. ‚Ä¢ GitHub, Travis CI and Trello, Slack for development tools. ‚Ä¢ Testing with JUnit, ScalaTest, FrisbyJS, Calabash and Selenium. ‚Ä¢ Kinesys, Spark and AWS Redshift for our data infrastructure.¬†

responsibilities: Company overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don‚Äôt intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world‚Äôs most successful organizations ‚Äì a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind ‚Äì but even as we continue to grow, we‚Äôre committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: YouTube At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun ‚Äî and we do it all together. The role: Enforcement Detection Analyst, Trust and Safety, YouTube - Singapore Fast-paced, dynamic, and proactive, YouTube‚Äôs Trust & Safety team is dedicated to making YouTube a safe place for users, viewers, and content creators around the world to belong, create, and express themselves. Whether understanding and solving their online content concerns, navigating within global legal frameworks, or writing and enforcing worldwide policy, the Trust & Safety team is on the frontlines of enhancing the YouTube experience, building internet safety, and protecting free speech in our ever-evolving digital world. Additional Role Description: As an Enforcement Detection Analyst, you will be responsible for identifying and removing disruptive content as quickly as possible. You will use advanced modeling and analytical techniques on hundreds of features against a massive corpus and hundreds of hours of new content being uploaded every minute.¬† Responsibilities: - Develop and implement strategies and models and heuristic rules to enforce YouTube content policies at scale across hundreds of millions of videos/comments. Leverage Machine Learning, as appropriate. - Deliver improvements to our performance metrics based on deep understanding of drivers of operations. Leverage deep programming skills to ensure that solutions fit within the current complex product and backend infrastructures. - Work closely with the Policy and Operations teams to understand the evolving policy enforcement landscape, and with Engineering teams to develop and test new features that address operational needs. - Provide rapid incident response for abuse problems, operating independently. Analyze and draw conclusions on root-causes and define and implement mitigation steps.
requirements: Minimum qualifications: - MS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience. - 2 years of work experience in a relevant field. - Experience with machine learning, programming, database querying (SQL) and statistics. - Experience with creating metrics to measure performance of models, building dashboards and reporting. Preferred qualifications: - Exceptional problem-solving and analytical abilities with a proven history of going above and beyond to make operational improvements and solve tough problems. - Experience or demonstrated interest in content policy and/or anti-abuse operations at scale. - Experience with machine learning tools, techniques, and systems. - Experience with abuse fighting at scale in similar product domains. - Demonstrated ability in working with a variety of stakeholders to gather requirements, explaining models, and iterating to make improvements. - Strong written and spoken communication skills.

responsibilities: Job Description A research engineer position is available immediately at the Institute for Infocomm Research (I¬≤R), A*STAR, Singapore. We are looking for strong candidates in the field of Artificial intelligence and deep learning, with an interest in working on both fundamental algorithms in large-scale machine learning or deep learning, and also applying it to practical problems in vertical domains. The position, based within the Program in Artificial Intelligence at I2R, entails working closely with a highly interdisciplinary team of researchers with training from leading universities like MIT, Stanford and CMU. The appointment will be based in Singapore for 2 years duration. Listed below are problems of interest in the Deep Learning 2.0 project: Multimodal Deep Learning: Towards effective learning from heterogeneous data sources Currently, deep learning is applied in various areas such as visual computing, speech recognition, text mining, etc. In each area, the learning model is trained with large amounts of data in isolation. A multimodal learning approach from heterogeneous data sources, including video, speech, text, etc. is necessary to achieve breakthrough in performance. Unsupervised Deep Learning: Towards 10X fewer labeled samples Labeling large amounts of training data is one of the most time-consuming steps in the deep learning pipeline, and is often not feasible. The aim is to achieve the same performance with 10x fewer labeled training samples. This is a strong step in the direction of unsupervised deep learning, where representations are learnt with large amounts of unlabeled unstructured data. Deep Learning on Embedded Devices: Towards 100X smaller models Current deep learning models have 10s of millions of neurons, making it infeasible for deployment on mobile and embedded hardware. The aim is to achieve models that are 100x smaller, with little loss in performance. This capability will also be critical for emerging neuromorphic platforms, where the number of spiking neurons is orders of magnitude smaller than in current state-of-the-art deep learning models. Online Deep Learning: Towards Near Real Time (NRT) model updates State-of-the-art deep learning models still take several days to train on expensive GPU infrastructure. A common problem is when new data (including new classes) are constantly added to an evolving, always-learning system. Algorithms to move towards real-time updates will be essential. Extreme Deep Learning: Training 1B neural networks efficiently The high model capacity of deep networks is why increasing amounts of data and model size improves performance. However, there are substantial challenges in hardware and algorithms challenges in training very large models efficiently. The aim is to address these challenges to achieve more efficient training. Deep Learning for Spoken Language Processing and Natural Language Understanding: Towards better modelling of human communication Language technology has made great advances through deep learning in the past five years, penetrating fields such as speech recognition and machine translation. However, there are still numerous challenges that need to be addressed, ranging from the requirement of specialized linguistic resources to large amounts of annotated data, and to insufficient theoretical grounding in deep learning. This aim attempts to address challenges that are often overlooked by major commercial AI players. White-Box Deep Learning: Towards interpretable and contextually informed models Current deep learning models are largely black-boxes that are not informed by contextual relations and provide little intuition. Improved abilities to regulate the learning process, and interpret the resulting predictions will be essential for the next wave of AI applications -- especially for complex learning scenarios and applications involving critical decisions. Incorporating Knowledge Graphs into Deep Learning: Towards better understanding of images Current deep learning systems today have no real understanding of images, with output typically a bunch of bounding boxes, learnt using a large number of label or sentence-level associations. Knowledge graphs like the MIT ConceptNet will be used to understand higher level semantics and relationships between entities, to improve classification accuracy.
requirements: Job Requirement  Minimum Bachelor¬†in Computer Science, Statistics, or Data Science intensive fields, with expertise in one or more of the following areas:  ¬†1. Large-scale machine learning ¬†2. Deep learning, supervised or unsupervised ¬†3. Applying state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to practical problems in different domains  Experience in corporate or application oriented environments is a plus. Ability to work independently, as well as in teams highly desired. Good communication skills for proposals, reports, and publications. Proficiency in spoken and written English. Strong programming abilities (e.g. Perl, Bash, C/C++, Java, Python, R, MATLAB) Computer vision and deep learning skills desirable  The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

responsibilities: Job Description A research engineer position is available immediately at the Institute for Infocomm Research (I¬≤R), A*STAR, Singapore. We are looking for strong candidates in the field of Artificial intelligence and deep learning, with an interest in working on both fundamental algorithms in large-scale machine learning or deep learning, and also applying it to practical problems in vertical domains. The position, based within the Program in Artificial Intelligence at I2R, entails working closely with a highly interdisciplinary team of researchers with training from leading universities like MIT, Stanford and CMU. The appointment will be based in Singapore for 2 years duration. Listed below are problems of interest in the Deep Learning 2.0 project: Multimodal Deep Learning: Towards effective learning from heterogeneous data sources Currently, deep learning is applied in various areas such as visual computing, speech recognition, text mining, etc. In each area, the learning model is trained with large amounts of data in isolation. A multimodal learning approach from heterogeneous data sources, including video, speech, text, etc. is necessary to achieve breakthrough in performance. Unsupervised Deep Learning: Towards 10X fewer labeled samples Labeling large amounts of training data is one of the most time-consuming steps in the deep learning pipeline, and is often not feasible. The aim is to achieve the same performance with 10x fewer labeled training samples. This is a strong step in the direction of unsupervised deep learning, where representations are learnt with large amounts of unlabeled unstructured data. Deep Learning on Embedded Devices: Towards 100X smaller models Current deep learning models have 10s of millions of neurons, making it infeasible for deployment on mobile and embedded hardware. The aim is to achieve models that are 100x smaller, with little loss in performance. This capability will also be critical for emerging neuromorphic platforms, where the number of spiking neurons is orders of magnitude smaller than in current state-of-the-art deep learning models. Online Deep Learning: Towards Near Real Time (NRT) model updates State-of-the-art deep learning models still take several days to train on expensive GPU infrastructure. A common problem is when new data (including new classes) are constantly added to an evolving, always-learning system. Algorithms to move towards real-time updates will be essential. Extreme Deep Learning: Training 1B neural networks efficiently The high model capacity of deep networks is why increasing amounts of data and model size improves performance. However, there are substantial challenges in hardware and algorithms challenges in training very large models efficiently. The aim is to address these challenges to achieve more efficient training. Deep Learning for Spoken Language Processing and Natural Language Understanding: Towards better modelling of human communication Language technology has made great advances through deep learning in the past five years, penetrating fields such as speech recognition and machine translation. However, there are still numerous challenges that need to be addressed, ranging from the requirement of specialized linguistic resources to large amounts of annotated data, and to insufficient theoretical grounding in deep learning. This aim attempts to address challenges that are often overlooked by major commercial AI players. White-Box Deep Learning: Towards interpretable and contextually informed models Current deep learning models are largely black-boxes that are not informed by contextual relations and provide little intuition. Improved abilities to regulate the learning process, and interpret the resulting predictions will be essential for the next wave of AI applications -- especially for complex learning scenarios and applications involving critical decisions. Incorporating Knowledge Graphs into Deep Learning: Towards better understanding of images Current deep learning systems today have no real understanding of images, with output typically a bunch of bounding boxes, learnt using a large number of label or sentence-level associations. Knowledge graphs like the MIT ConceptNet will be used to understand higher level semantics and relationships between entities, to improve classification accuracy.
requirements: Job Requirement  Minimum Bachelor in Computer Science, Statistics, or Data Science intensive fields, with expertise in one or more of the following areas:  ¬†1. Large-scale machine learning ¬†2. Deep learning, supervised or unsupervised ¬†3. Applying state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to practical problems in different domains  Experience in corporate or application oriented environments is a plus. Ability to work independently, as well as in teams highly desired. Good communication skills for proposals, reports, and publications. Proficiency in spoken and written English. Strong programming abilities (e.g. Perl, Bash, C/C++, Java, Python, R, MATLAB) Computer vision and deep learning skills desirable  The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

jobtitle: SENIOR SOFTWARE ENGINEER - SEARCH LANGUAGE PROCESSING, APPLE MEDIA PRODUCTS
responsibilities: Engineer in Singapore. Innovate at Apple. Our engineers have created some tough acts to follow, and they continue to lead us to innovative breakthroughs. Because they are driven not by what would be easy, but by what would be amazing. Team We are a diverse collective of thinkers and doers, continually reimagining what's possible to help us all find what we love in new ways. The AMP Search team powers search for iTunes, App Store, Apple Music, Apple TV, Podcasts, Books and more on iOS, macOS, tvOS and watchOS. As a member of the Apple Media Products Search team you will be working on various components of the Search platform - search ranking, search query interpretation, language models, index data modelling and pipelines. Responsibilities will include design, development and maintenance of core search components that serve customers worldwide. You will also be responsible for bringing the latest in search and discovery ideas to production at a large scale. If you want to craft new ways for customers to discover content in a rapidly growing catalog on the Apple ecosystem of devices and platforms, this is the place to be. The Apple Media Products Search Team is looking for extraordinary engineers to help build next-generation search features for Apple's ground breaking devices and platforms. We are a key part of the Apple ecosystem, supporting all of users. We operate globally in languages around the world. We strive to provide the best search experience for our customers. YOU WILL:  Have a major impact on the way people search & discover Apple Media content on Apple devices worldwide. Be part of a team with strong expertise in software engineering, information retrieval, language processing, data mining, machine learning, scalable systems, and parallel processing (Hadoop, Scala, Spark). Be responsible for improving search recall and precision. Use big data technology to evaluate and prioritize content discovery features. Conduct AB Tests to ensure we objectively measure improvements. Ensure successful deployment of features, code, data, and models in production. Work in collaboration with other world-class engineers, researchers, and statisticians to ensure the features and models are functioning at or above expected performance levels. Work on Natural Language Processing (NLP), Tokenization, Stemming, Lemmatization, and Synonym mining Improve Search Recall, Text Indexing and Query Rewrites Design & Implement solutions for automated unit and integration tests that enable continuous integration and delivery.  Support search:  On all devices (macOS, iOS, tvOS, watchOS, Siri/HomePod) Across media products (App Store, iTunes, Music, Video, Books, Podcasts) Globally in languages from Arabic to Russian and everything in between
requirements: BS in Computer Science or equivalent industry experience 5+ years of relevant industry experience Experience with Search, Natural Language Processing, or Machine Learning experience Experience building big data pipelines with Hadoop, Java, Scala, and Spark Passion. Our customers love what we do at Apple and we want the same from our engineers  Preferred Skills:  Deep understanding of the search and information retrieval fundamentals including indexing, query understanding, retrieval and ranking Experience building search solutions with Lucene / Solr / Elasticsearch or related search technologies Familiarity with A/B experimentation and data/metric-driven product development

The team specializes in the development and evolution of MyRepublic''s industry-leading BSS/OSS platform that enables agility and automation across the group''s 4 operating markets. With a core focus in software engineering, the team adopts best-in-class technologies, methodologies and standards to push the boundaries of disruption for the TelcoTech industry  RESPONSIBILITIES  MyRepublic looking for a machine learning engineers that will help us build a data lake and discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data and help us make smarter decisions to deliver even better products. Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy
