jobtitle: UX Researcher - 6 month renewable contract - Singapore
responsibilities: About the client We support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities.¬† Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success. ¬† About the Team Our purpose is to respond to digital imperative to transform our business and industry into one that operates intelligently at the speed of digital. The team looks to simplify and digitize business processes and drive new ways of working by applying intelligent automation services into our processes. You will be joining a global multi-disciplinary team focusing on driving improvement in business outcomes by creating Intelligent Process Automation solutions around the 5 technology pillars: Robotics Process Automation, Natural Language Process, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, and Smart Workflows. The Intelligence Automation Team is an early stage initiative running in a fast paced and highly collaborative start up environment. To be successful you will need to be flexible, entrepreneurial, always learning, and always striving to find better ways of doing things. The team values having deep technical and functional experts working together as a group towards the goal of creating Intelligent Process Automation. responsibilities: A Research Fellow position is available in the School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering at Nanyang Technological University. Established in 1981, the SCHOOL OF ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONIC ENGINEERING (EEE) is one of the founding Schools of the Nanyang Technological University. Built on a culture of excellence, the School is renowned for its high academic standards and strong tradition in research. To support teaching and cutting-edge research, EEE is host to 11 research centres and more than 50 laboratories, which are well-equipped with modern facilities and state-of-the-art equipment. With about 200 faculty members and an enrolment of more than 4,000, of which about 1,300 are graduate students, it is one of the largest EEE schools in the world. Job Description To treat neurological patients, an in-depth analysis and understanding of patient-specific EEG is required and critical. However, visual inspection of EEG recordings is prohibitively time-consuming, and most hospitals do not have the personnel for this task. Automated algorithms to inspect EEG will allow us to analyse much larger volumes of EEG signals, in turn allowing us to build up a detailed database of waveforms associated with epilepsy and other neurological disorders. It has potential application in real-time seizure detection, non-expert EEG evaluation, and improved understanding of neurological disorders. We will develop deep learning methods for analysing EEG signals, which is an entirely new approach with much potential. Deep learning methods have consistently outperformed standard methods for speech and image analysis, and are expected to outshine existing methodologies also for biomedical signals and EEG in particular. In this project, we have the following aims: Aim1: To apply existing deep learning algorithms (CNN and LSTM recurrent networks) for the specific application of recognizing patterns in time series, and identify strengths and weaknesses of the existing algorithms. Aim2: To develop novel deep learning algorithms based on Bayesian variational inference and other approaches, for the specific application of recognizing patterns in time series. Aim3:¬† To apply these deep learning algorithms for reliable EEG-based BCI classification and automatic detection of epileptic seizures from pediatric EEG (Physionet dataset). The Research Fellow will assist in conducting this research, writing journal publications, and preparing grant applications.
requirements: PhD degree in electrical engineering, computer science, or statistics Minimum 2 years of relevant experience Required skills include signal processing, machine learning, EEG analysis, programming in Matlab, Python, C++, or C  We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified. ¬†

Our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. For more information about I2R, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg The Deep Learning 2.0 program is a multi-year A*STAR Al program, focused on capturing the Next wave of deep learning. The program is focused on ¬†  10x open problems in deep learning algorithmic research: thrusts include learning with 10 x fewer labelled samples, incorporating knowledge graphs into deep learning, online deep learning, and white-box deep learning. Next generation hardware for deep learning: we are looking beyond GPUs and TPUs, and reimagining the entire hardware stack for deep learning from algorithms all the way down to silicon New emerging enterprise applications for deep learning: ranging from personalized medicine, finance, health-care, 10T and advanced semiconductor manufacturing.  ¬† We are looking for a researcher, with have experience at least in one of the following topics: A. GANs in speech / vision / language B. Bayesian learning, Causal Inference C. Lifelong learning: from concepts to tasks D. Knowledge graphs E. Bottom-up reasoning G. Innovative ideas to tackle the YouTube8M data set H. Multimodal Q&A Systems I. Game theory J. Optimization techniques K. Active Deep Learning ¬† The researcher should be able to conceptualize ambitious R&D programs working with other researchers in DL2. ¬†The skills should be complementary to the existing knowhow of the existing DL2 unit, whose scope is briefly described below. ¬† ¬† ¬†
requirements: ¬†  Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistics, or Data Science intensive fields, with expertise in one or more of the following areas: 	  Large-scale machine learning   Deep learning, supervised or unsupervised   Applying state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to practical problems in different domains    Experience in corporate or application oriented environments is a plus. Ability to work independently, as well as in teams highly desired. Good communication skills for proposals, reports, and publications Experience with one of Tensor Flow, Theano, Caffe, CNTK. Skills Strong programming abilities (e.g. Perl, Bash, C/C++, Java, Python, R, MATLAB) Computer vision and deep learning skills desirable  The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. responsibilities: The Rapid-Rich Object SEarch (ROSE) Lab is a research initiative under Nanyang Technological University (NTU).¬† It aims to create a platform for fast mobile searches on object databases.¬† The three key thrusts of the ROSE Lab are:¬† (i) visual object search, (ii) video analytics & deep learning, and (iii) multimedia forensics & biometrics.¬† Resources at the ROSE Lab consist of NTU Faculty, Researchers, PhD Students, and Visiting Scholars & Students from other institutions from around the world.¬†Learn more about ROSE Lab at http://rose.ntu.edu.sg/ Job Description The successful applicant will be responsible for the development of human re-identification algorithms, APIs, and toolkits. This includes:  Develop an algorithm for human Re-ID across cameras using Deep Networks in the Wild Building APIs (Application Programming Interfaces) by using Python or C/C++ to the developed algorithm and testing them for functionality and performance  The successful applicant will typically be on a 1 year contract basis, with the option to renew based on the candidate‚Äôs performance.¬†
requirements: The project involves the human re-identification across surveillance cameras, under realistic conditions (different viewing angles, various weather and illumination conditions). Convolutional and/or recurrent neural networks will be employed.  Bachelor degree in Computer Science and/or Engineering. Expert practical knowledge of state-of-the-art research in human re-id, and/or object recognition in surveillance videos. Applicant should have technical skills in computer vision and machine learning. Applicants with experience in deep learning with convolutional and/or recurrent neural networks are highly preferred. Ideally, the applicant should have experience working with large-scale datasets. Applicant should be comfortable implementing algorithms in languages such as C/C++ and Python. Experience with deep learning frameworks like PyTorch & TensorFlow, or CUDA programming would be highly beneficial. Good interpersonal skills, with the ability to work from varied backgrounds.¬† Fresh graduates can apply.  We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

responsibilities: About¬†Institute for Infocomm Research (I¬≤R)  The Institute for Infocomm Research (I¬≤R) is a member of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) family and is Singapore‚Äôs largest ICT research institute. Our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualisation solutions. For more information about I¬≤R, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg We are looking for highly-motivated and skilled data engineer to work on a new initiative on developing advanced automatic data pre-processing techniques for facilitating key data analytics applications in various industry domains, including advanced manufacturing and engineering, financial services, healthcare, and urban development. Successful candidate will work with a team of data scientists and data engineers to develop novel methodology for automatic data integrity check, data imputation, and segmentation for structured data and time-series data commonly generated by industry companies. Successful candidate will have the opportunity to tap into a large pool of industrial data from different disciplines and to interact with the companies to understand their real data needs. Successful candidate will also engage in project scoping with industry companies to develop solution to address the data analytics needs. ¬† ¬† ¬†

jobtitle: Strategic Marketing Analyst, Scalable Marketing Solutions - Singapore
responsibilities: Company overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don‚Äôt intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world‚Äôs most successful organizations ‚Äì a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind ‚Äì but even as we continue to grow, we‚Äôre committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Online Partnerships Group - Global Partnerships Google helps our partners find better ways to reach their audiences and manage their digital businesses. In return, our partners provide great content for our products, and they syndicate Google products to enhance their sites and apps. Global Partnerships team members expand and support these relationships by continually finding new opportunities and solving technical problems for our partners. The wider Global Partnerships team includes a variety of different organizations, including CorpDev, Emerging Business Development, Strategy and Operations, Google for Startups, Area 120 and our Display Advertising Business. The role: Strategic Marketing Analyst, Scalable Marketing Solutions - Singapore The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) uses our portfolio of product solutions, including AdSense and Google Marketing Platform tools, to help online publishers grow their businesses. You'll provide creative, industry-leading online advertising solutions for publishers and developers and identify new opportunities. Some of the largest publishers on the web rely on our products and we're always trying to exceed their expectations and strengthen our long-term partner relationships. We help grow Google's business with the largest online publishers and provide account management for users of AdSense, Google Ad Manager and more. Additional Role Description: As a Strategic Marketing Analyst, you will use your analytical and technical skills to grow the online businesses of AdSense publishers and AdMob developers. You‚Äôll be immersed in massive datasets using Google Infrastructure and tools. You‚Äôll connect your data expertise with the knowledge of other subject matter experts to uncover and develop new tactics our publishers can use to grow their businesses. You‚Äôll partner with marketers to make sure they have compelling data that will be used to reach out to a massive number of publishers with customized, personalized messages, while using and growing your data analytics skills to solve challenging problems. The work is a mix of campaign opportunity sizing, data mining, lead generation, measurement, data exploration, data analysis, and automation. Responsibilities: - Mine massive datasets and analyze them to create customized recommendations at scale to help our publishers grow their businesses. - Extract and transform datasets, explore and highlight insights through data visualization. Transform complicated problems into simpler tractable ones. - Build data pipelines and scripts to enable automation of scalable sales and marketing campaigns. - Design measurement metrics focused on strategic priorities, design A/B tests, and measure results for marketing campaigns. - Engage with the broader sales, marketing, product, and engineering teams to understand strategic priorities and identify potential recommendations that will resonate with publishers.
requirements: Minimum qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, related field or equivalent practical experience. - Experience in SQL scripting. - Experience working with datasets/data warehouses. Preferred qualifications: - Experience with R, HTML, Python, JavaScript, and/or other languages. - Experience with statistical and quantitative modeling (e.g., regression, classification, clustering, etc.). - Excellent communication skills with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

culture with the mindset to train and coach, helping the team to overcome work challenges and contribute effectively Provide effective recruitment advice, guidance¬†and¬†solutions to all hiring He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisation‚Äôs approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation.

jobtitle: Faculty Positions in Construction Automation - Civil Engineering
responsibilities: The Department of Civil & Environmental Engineering, National University of Singapore (NUS) invites applications for faculty positions in the area of construction automation. The candidate should hold a doctorate in civil engineering and construction and project management, preferably with background and experience in, but not limited to, autonomous system, augmented reality, building information modeling (BIM), smart system, internet of things (IoT), big data analytics, horizontal and vertical integration, artificial intelligence and 3D printing. Relevant experience and professional qualifications (e.g. professional engineer) in civil engineering will be considered favorably. The opening is at the Assistant Professor or Lecturer level. Exceptionally well qualified applicants may be considered at the Associate Professor level. Postdoctoral experience is highly desirable. The successful candidate must be able to teach effectively in English at both undergraduate and graduate levels and develop an active research programme. NUS offers internationally competitive remuneration, relocation assistance and other benefits. Newly recruited tenurable faculty members are eligible for start-up grants to facilitate the establishment of their research and development in NUS. Details of terms and benefits are available on http://www.nus.edu.sg/careers/whatyougettoenjoy.html. Interested candidates should submit with¬†their applications a detailed curriculum vitae, copies of transcripts, statements of research and teaching interests and professional goals, and the names of three referees. Further information on the Department of Civil & Environmental Engineering is available at: http://www.eng.nus.edu.sg/cee/. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
requirements: At least a doctorate degree in Civil Engineering with specialization in construction management.

jobtitle: Executive / Senior Executive (Systems and Data Branch), Planning Division
company: Ministry of Social and Family Development
responsibilities:
The Planning Division (PD) under SPSG oversees Group-level planning and strategy development, systems and data management, data analytics, manpower planning and internal capability development. The Systems and Data Branch (SDB) oversees, manages and develops ICT systems to support service delivery and data sharing across the social service sector.
¬†
Responsibilities:
You will be support MSF‚Äôs mission of nurturing resilient individuals, strong families and a caring society by equipping front line social service professionals with systems and data to enable them to perform their work in an effective and efficient manner.
You will work with MSF/ITG and IT vendors in ensuring the development and management of existing and new Information Technology (IT) systems overseen by SDB. This entails developing and implementing operational workflows for business users; coordinating the gathering of requirements from business users and prioritising the service requests and system enhancements; and working with MSF/ITG and IT vendors to roll out the prioritised enhancements to better enable the IT systems in supporting service delivery.
You will also be responsible for handling enquiries and user feedback, and generating data analysis and reports. Over the course of the work, you will have the opportunity to work closely with various internal and external stakeholders e.g. Social Service Offices, Family Service Centres, other ministries, non-government organisations and private vendors.
¬†
Competencies required:
You are proactive, dynamic and always looking to learn new things. Besides strong analytical and project management skills, you are people-centric with good written and verbal communication skills. You are resourceful and work well both independently and as part of a team. Knowledge of and experience working in social sector environment is an advantage. Strong skills in data handling is also preferred e.g. experience in usage of data extraction tools, proficiency in MS Excel.

responsibilities: ABOUT TAIGER Headquartered in Singapore, TAIGER is a fast-growing Artificial Intelligence (AI) company with a global footprint. Our mission is to help organizations optimize operational efficiencies by automating complex cognitive tasks. We are a market leader and the pioneer of Knowledge Work AutomationTM. The solutions we provide offer unparalleled accuracy in information extraction for industry leaders across the financial services, government sectors and more. TAIGER is recognized as a Gartner Cool Vendor. Find out more about us at www.taiger.com and www.linkedin.com/company/taiger/. DIRECTOR, PRODUCT We are looking for an experienced leader that is passionate about the potential of TAIGER. You should be genuinely excited by the prospect of building new functions and leading a passionate team of high performers as TAIGER expands in scale; and be motivated by the proposition of your contributions having a real impact on TAIGER‚Äôs growth. RESPONSIBILITIES  Work closely with internal and external customers, sales and engineering teams to oversee delivery of product requirements in-line with stakeholder needs, technical capabilities and with alignment to success metrics. Drive modern forms of product planning, customer discovery, product discovery, and product development process, as well as ensure successful execution and implementation of product roadmaps. Define and drive TAIGER‚Äôs product strategy, by developing a clear product roadmap with realistic milestones and measurable outcomes. Ensure that TAIGER‚Äôs product remain competitive, relevant and innovative in the market by comparing existing solutions against relevant products to gather a strong understanding of latest products trends and the Artificial Intelligence domain. Lead and build the internal product function for TAIGER, ensuring that resource capabilities, and technical limitations are optimized to achieve company product vision. Oversee external opportunities, and ensure that sales decisions are supported with internal technical documentations, data-analytics and product collaterals to enable data-driven decision making.  ¬†
requirements: REQUIREMENTS  BSc, MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or related disciplines. 5+ years of experience in Product Management for technology / software products or Artificial Intelligence domain-related product experience. Demonstrated understanding and interest in the Artificial Intelligence industry and driving innovation aligned with technology trends and customer needs. Prior experience leading product functions within large-scale technology, financial or government organizations converting strategic product plans to measurable go-to-market outcomes. Expertise in translating customer needs into user stories through qualitative needs analysis user research methods and research analysis creating, conducting, and analysing usability evaluations. Proven track record in stakeholder management and internal evangelism. You should be able to inspire and motivate teams and stakeholders to drive results in line with TAIGER‚Äôs vision.  YOU ARE RIGHT FOR THE TEAM IF  You have strong problem-solving skills and possess a high degree of creativity and resourcefulness. You have a track record of successfully delivering quality, on-time results. You are a strong communicator with ability to deliver clear and impactful messages. You possess effective time management and networking skills. You demonstrate excellent organizational, analytical and strategic skills.  In TAIGER we believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will result in a better workplace for our team and a better product for our clients. Join the growing team at TAIGER today! ¬† *TAIGER does not engage any recruitment agencies for recruitment of talents into our company. All job applications should be submitted directly to TAIGER.

responsibilities: About Us The We Company‚Äôs mission is to elevate the world‚Äôs consciousness. Our global platform reimagines and positively impacts how we work, live and grow through three distinct business lines: WeWork‚Äôs mission is to create a world where people work to make a life, not just a living; WeLive‚Äôs mission is to build a world where no one feels alone; WeGrow‚Äôs mission is to unleash every human‚Äôs superpowers. Through design, technology, and hospitality we are creating a community that helps people live life with purpose and have a meaningful impact in the world. The We Company began 2019 with more than 400,000 members. In less than ten years, we‚Äôve built a global network of 400 locations across 100 cities and nearly 30 countries, and we‚Äôre just getting started. About the Role We are in search of a Space Planner who is eager to be an integral part of our Due Diligence process for new WeWork locations as well as partnering with our Design Strategists for Powered by We (PxWe) locations. ¬†As a Space Planner, you will actively engage in the spatial and financial evaluation of potential new properties sourced by the Real Estate team. Ideally you will have professional experience in space planning, but this position is also good for someone with an architectural background who is highly efficient, solution-oriented, data savvy and BIM fluent. Having a firm grasp on both spatial reasoning and computational design is integral to succeeding in this role and we want to find someone passionate and committed to it. ¬† ¬† ¬† Responsibilities  Work directly with real estate and design strategy teams to complete test fits for potential new WeWork locations and Powered by We clients. Analyze existing building conditions and incorporate WeWork or PxWe client space standards and other agreed to programmatic elements into optimized space plans to determine feasibility Generate USF plans and calculate USF for potential new locations Make recommendations to enhance space standards, operational efficiency, service delivery, cost savings, and innovative service advancements Prepare documentation for internal and external review, presentation, and approval Utilize data analytics and analysis tools to guide the team in generating optimal space solutions Reports to Head of Architecture
requirements: Qualifications  Bachelor's degree and minimum 2 years practical experience in space planning for commercial real estate or hospitality clients. Experience in multi-family mixed use developments, retail, or other building typologies may also be considered. Professional experience with Revit is required. jobtitle: Customer Engineer, Data Analytics Specialist, Google Cloud - Singapore
responsibilities: Company overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don‚Äôt intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world‚Äôs most successful organizations ‚Äì a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind ‚Äì but even as we continue to grow, we‚Äôre committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Google Cloud Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what‚Äôs next for their business ‚Äî all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers ‚Äî developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies ‚Äî see the benefits of our technology come to life. The role: Customer Engineer, Data Analytics Specialist, Google Cloud - Singapore When leading companies choose Google Cloud it's a huge win for spreading the power of cloud computing globally. Once educational institutions, government agencies, and other businesses sign on to use Google Cloud products, you come in to facilitate making their work more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You assist fellow sales Googlers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You liaise with the product marketing management and engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google Cloud products. Additional Role Description: As a Customer Engineer, you'll work with technical Sales teams as a networking subject matter expert to differentiate Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, explaining technical features, helping customers design architectures, and problem-solving. Responsibilities: - Support local sales teams in pursuit of key business opportunities, engaging customers to address aspects of the data lifecycle - As part of working with the Sales team, identify business and technical requirements, conduct full technical discovery and architect client solutions to meet gathered requirements - Take responsibility for leading technical projects, including such activities as technology advocacy, supporting bid responses, product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of supporting technical resources - Work hands-on with Google Cloud Platform products to demonstrate and prototype integrations in customer/partner environments. Travel as required around EMEA for meetings, technical reviews and onsite delivery activities - Prepare and deliver product messaging in an effort to highlight the Google Cloud Platform value proposition, using techniques that include whiteboard and slide presentations, product demonstrations, white papers and RFI response documents
requirements: Minimum qualifications: -¬†Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience. - Experience with traditional Analytic Warehouse solutions including Teradata, Netezza, Vertica, Oracle, SQL-Server and "Big Data" technologies. - Experience in implementing analytics systems architecture. - Experience working with new and emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the technology space. Preferred qualifications: - Extensive technical sales experience or professional consulting experience in the fields of cloud computing, data, information lifecycle management and Big Data - Experience with developing data warehousing, data lakes, batch or real-time event processing and ETL workflows solutions (i.e. Informatica, Talend, Alooma, SAP, Data Services) which could include architecture design, implementing, tuning, schema design, and query optimization of scalable and distributed systems - Experience in writing code in a common development languages such as Java, Python, JavaScript, C++, Scala, R or Go - Understanding of DNS, TCP, Firewalls, Proxy Servers, Load Balancing, VPN and VPC and working knowledge of Linux.

jobtitle: Director  /  Senior Manager, Indirect Tax , APTC, Singapore
responsibilities: The indirect tax team within EY's Asia Pacific Tax Center ("APTC") is expanding and looking for strong candidates at the Director / Senior Manager level to join our team. The opportunity The indirect tax team within EY's Asia Pacific Tax Centre ("APTC") operates as a team of highly experienced indirect tax professionals who are our centre of excellence delivering APAC wide solutions to¬†multi-national companies. Work comprises of four core components:   Delivery of operational excellence initiatives concerning supply chain, operating model design and performance improvement that drive strategic business growth for our clients (Operating Model Effectiveness ("OME"))   Digital Indirect Tax including advising our clients on how to build a robust indirect tax strategy for profitable growth in the face of vast digital change, including advising on the indirect tax considerations relevant to cross border digital operating models implemented by both traditional and disruptive companies   Working with our tax technology and transformation practice group to design and implement technology and data supported solutions to optimise indirect tax processes and identify indirect tax saving opportunities   APAC wide indirect tax advisory engagements comprising both global trade and VAT, providing our clients with the APAC solution   All components are¬†increasingly supported by the use of indirect tax technology and data analytics. Although prior experience of technology and analytics is not required, any candidate must be actively interested in developing themselves in this area. Your key responsibilities¬†   Stay abreast of Digital Tax Administration trends and indirect tax policy changes impacting the way our clients do business   Demonstrate an understanding of complex supply chain concepts and effectively apply customs and indirect tax knowledge to client situations   Assist in developing and delivering quality OME and Digital Indirect Tax work products in a timely and responsive manner   Thoroughly analyse client information. Prepare quality practical approaches to the client's situation   Develop recommendations and implementation plans for clients and team members   Run client relationships and leverage internal/ external relationships to generate revenue opportunities for the firm   Develop deep sector and geography insights on indirect tax issues and advise clients accordingly (the role is not a mere project management role coordinating advice from other EY office locations)   Work seamlessly with tax and advisory colleagues across APAC and Rest Of World (ROW)
requirements: To qualify for the role you must have   A Bachelor's degree in any subject   Minimum of 6 years of relevant work experience; 8 years of relevant experience for Director   Strong technical knowledge across either Global Trade or VAT (ideally both); full technical training will be provided on indirect tax, customs or digital tax areas as needed   Excellent verbal / written communication skills in business English   Strong project management skills   Ability to work in a fast-paced professional services environment and cope with undefined situations¬†   Willingness to travel in APAC   Experience working in professional services firms and/ or industry   Ideally, you‚Äôll also have   Experience working in Asia or with Asian languages ¬†   What we look for Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you‚Äôll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.¬†¬†¬†¬† What working at EY offers EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you‚Äôll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:¬†   Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around   Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career   The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that‚Äôs right for you¬†   About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. responsibilities: Our clients rely on us in providing them with a candid and reliable overview of their risk landscape and the controls in place. As a data analytics professional supporting this team, you will be responsible for leading the team in performing data driven analysis to help identify areas to enhance process and technology controls, improve IT operations and compliance processes as well as to achieve company-wide cost efficiencies. We will be looking to you to apply your knowledge and experience to shape our services. You‚Äôll build valuable relationships with clients and develop strong capabilities, through both formal training and on-the-job training.

You will lead the data analytics team to support you in the development analytics test procedures and statistical models and algorithms to analyse client‚Äôs data to identify instances of process or control gaps, occurrences of unauthorised or non-compliant activities within the organization and cost optimization opportunities. You will bring a level of data analytics knowledge to our clients and play an important role in communicating the solution in client meetings and workshops by providing high level understanding of data analytics in the risk domain and responding to client queries. ¬† Skills and attributes for success   Ability to network and build strong relationships with internal stakeholders and external clients   Strong project management and leadership skills with the ability to manage multiple projects concurrently   Strong presentation and communication skills   Thrive under pressure and handle ambiguous situations   ¬† To qualify for the role you must have   At least a recognized university degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics or any other relevant discipline   At least 5¬†years of work experience, with at least 2 years as a project lead responsible for delivering data analytics projects preferably in an advisory role.   Good knowledge of data analytics modelling techniques and statistical analysis and proficient in data analytics tools such SPSS, R, Python or SQL   Good communications skills and be able to explain analysis, both verbally and in writing, to others and translate analysis into a clear business plan   Proficiency in computer software (Word/ Excel/ Outlook) ¬†   Ideally, you‚Äôll also have   Knowledge of process risk and controls concepts   What we look for We‚Äôre interested in flexible professionals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritise shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. You‚Äôll also need the confidence to give professional advice and guidance to colleagues and clients from a diverse range of cultures, often with limited information ‚Äì both verbally and in writing. If you‚Äôre a fast learner, with strong influencing skills and a genuine passion for information system security, this role is for you. ¬† What working at EY offers We offer a competitive compensation package where you‚Äôll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. We also offer you:  Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that‚Äôs right for you  ¬† About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we‚Äôre using the finance products, expertise and systems we‚Äôve developed to build a better working world. responsibilities: The National University of Singapore is recruiting a Deputy Director for the Lloyd‚Äôs Register Foundation Institute for the Public Understanding of Risk (LRFIPUR), National University of Singapore (NUS). Founded in 1905, NUS is consistently ranked among the world‚Äôs top 30 universities and Asia‚Äôs top 2 universities. It is an innovative, research-intensive university with over 36,000 students from 100 countries.¬† ¬† Background Established in 2016, LRFIPUR is the first of its kind in Asia and aspires to become a world leading centre of excellence that will inspire the public understanding of risk in Asia and globally. The Institute will undertake independent research and education, building connections with practical end-users such as policy makers, decision makers and opinion formers in governments, industry sectors, regulators, the media and the general public. It will be multi-disciplinary, spanning engineering, statistics, sociology, and psychology, including the application of big-data analytics to on-line data sources to better understand public attitudes and anxieties around everyday risks. ¬† This Institute aims be a magnet attracting top international risk-related experts for cross-learning and collaboration that will develop into a renowned global institution for global risk understanding. The direction, priorities and output of the Institute will be independent in order to earn public credibility. It will also provide objective commentary on hot topics surrounding the popular understanding of risk. The Institute will generate new understanding and develop new tools and approaches applied to enhancing the public understanding of risk and promoting communication between all stakeholders in society.
requirements: The Institute seeks to hire a world-renowned scholar or industry expert in a relevant field to be its Deputy Director. Successful applicants should have proven experience and a strong track record in running similar-sized international, multidisciplinary programmes on the scale intended for the Institute. The appointment of Deputy Director is a full-time position with generous support for research and outreach activities. ¬† The Deputy Director will support the Director and be part of the Institute‚Äôs management board, which works in consultation with the Institute‚Äôs Governing Board to provide leadership in research, education and outreach. jobtitle: Sales Strategy and Operations Manager - Singapore
responsibilities: Company overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don‚Äôt intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world‚Äôs most successful organizations ‚Äì a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind ‚Äì but even as we continue to grow, we‚Äôre committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Sales Operations The Go-to-Market Operations (GtM) team ensures Google's complex and ever-evolving Ads business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy, and ensuring flawless execution and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major Ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas. Team members are analytical and strategic, with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done. The role: Sales Strategy and Operations Manager - Singapore The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives. Additional Role Description: As a Sales Strategy and Operations Manager for Google‚Äôs Asia Pacific business, you will be responsible for leading, supporting and project managing a diverse range of strategy projects and initiatives that are critical to the future growth of Google‚Äôs business in Asia Pacific. In this role, you will engage and coordinate closely with a large range of Google‚Äôs global, regional and local teams. Responsibilities: - Drive strategic initiatives with data analytics and insights. - Develop and shape differentiated growth strategies and efficiency initiatives for Google in APAC countries collaborating cross-functionally across the various stakeholders and assets. - Provide operational and strategic management updates and support the operations of the regional APAC business and management agenda. - Manage the strategy development and communication process with senior executives across all levels. - Drive strategy implementation initiatives and manage regional and global programs across APAC into measurable growth or share impact.
requirements: Minimum qualifications: - MBA degree or equivalent practical experience - 5 years of experience in a strategy consulting company or equivalent Preferred qualifications: - Experience in Internet, Media, Technology industries. - Experience in engaging across Asian markets and cultures. - Experience in operational topics and strategy implementation with hands-on engagement style. - Demonstrated experience and success in leading and developing teams with a strong focus on performance, coaching, mentoring and collaboration. - Convincing executive presence and demonstrated influencing skills. - Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.

jobtitle: Operations, Securities Division Operations, Equities Trading Services, Analyst
responsibilities: OPERATIONS Operations is a dynamic, multi-faceted division that partners with all parts of the firm to provide banking, securities, and asset management services to clients around the world. In addition, Operations provides essential risk management and controls to preserve and enhance the firm's assets and its reputation. For every new product launched and every trade executed, it is Operations that develops and manages the processes and controls that enable business flow. YOUR IMPACT¬† Are you looking to join a dynamic and fast paced team, applying your analytical and problem solving skills for maximum impact,¬†whilst deepening your knowledge of Equity Derivatives? Equity Trading Services is seeking a professional who is looking to partner¬†with our business and other internal and external stakeholders to provide market leading business enablement and risk and control¬†services.¬† OUR IMPACT¬† Our team of critical thinkers partners with groups in all areas of the firm to perform financial analytics, reporting, data analytics and¬†engineering. Our division also provides critical operations design and handles capital markets operations to ensure business flows¬†smoothly across our global offices. From day one, team members play a vital role in upholding the three Operations principles of¬†client focus, process innovation, and risk management.¬† Equity Trading Services provides front to back post-execution support to all equity based derivative activity in Asia. The Middle¬†Office team has critical focus on front office day to day risk and trading surveillance, new issuances, client service, corporate¬†actions processing and strategic firm and business infrastructure projects.¬†  Middle Office acts as first point of contact for the various Equities Trading desks, assisting in the execution of both new¬†client and hedging activity. Clients execute trades across a range of product wrappers e.g OTC, Securitised , Synthetic and it is¬†Middle Office‚Äôs responsibility to ensure positions are booked and maintained correctly in our risk systems. There is a strong¬†emphasis on knowledge and expertise which requires that all team members are fully versed in products and systems used as well¬†as the processes and procedures that must be followed when performing day to day tasks.¬†  HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL¬†  Prepare to gain a comprehensive understanding of the operational process lifecycle by interacting with internal and external¬†stakeholders including clients, trading desks, brokers, Sales, Structuring and other federation teams in order to work toward the¬†shared goal of business enablement and risk mitigation¬† Partner with a team of product experts to review all operational aspects of the trade flow while gaining strong technical knowledge,¬†risk control and commercial awareness¬† Use your inquisitive mind set to identify efficiency opportunities with respect to process flow methodology as well as enhance scalability¬† Leverage your quantitative skills to decompose complex regulatory and operational process requirement, and propose creative, robust solutions¬† Oversight & ownership of the full front to back operational flow ensuring that seamless execution of trades, new business and flow¬†enhancements¬†
requirements: SKILLS & EXPERIENCE WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR¬†  Ability to demonstrate a sound of understanding of a range of Equity Derivative products as well as Cash Securities. Strong Team-¬†working skills ‚Äì for working with both internal departments¬†and globally¬† Track record in the development of client relationships and key stakeholders, both internally and externally¬† Ability to gain a strong understanding of the business and work with Prime Brokerage, Marketing, Structuring, Trading and Sales¬†desks¬† Excellent communication and interpersonal skills¬† Ability to thrive under pressure¬† Strong leadership skills essential ‚Äì this role will require a self-starter who can manage competing deadlines and can prioritize¬†appropriately  ¬© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2019. jobtitle: Operations, Reg & Control Ops, Regulatory Ops - Derivatives Regulatory Reporting - Associate (51814)
responsibilities: YOUR IMPACT We are looking for a professional individual who wants to apply their financial market knowledge and further develop their understanding of a growing sector of the financial markets at the heart of regulatory reform.¬† With the continued high rate of change in the regulatory reporting space, Regulatory Operations professionals have the platform to significantly impact the Operations landscape and the wider business. OUR IMPACT OPERATIONS Our team of critical thinkers partners with groups in all areas of the firm to perform financial analytics and reporting and data analytics and engineering. Our division also provides critical operations design and handles capital markets operations to ensure business flows smoothly across our global offices. From day one, team members play a vital role in upholding the three Operations principles of client focus, process innovation, and risk management. REGULATORY OPERATIONS The Derivative Regulatory Operations group sits within Regulatory Operations and is responsible for ensuring Goldman Sachs is compliant to its non-financial reporting obligations and acts as the single point of contact for all regulatory related client engagements across Operations. The role provides an excellent opportunity to work in a high-profile team and to contribute to Goldman Sachs and its clients demonstrating excellent leadership, commercial effectiveness and outstanding client service.¬† It is a fantastic opportunity for someone who is motivated, ambitious and excited about contributing to our business as part of a team who are responsible for driving change within a demanding and complex environment. HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL  Partner with many other areas of the firm including the Front Office, Middle Office, Technology, Legal, Compliance, as well as interaction with external clients and regulators to support various reporting functions. Respond to internal or external queries regarding regulatory obligations Perform and lead analysis on remediation and corrective actions working closely with production team, remediation BAs and technology teams. jobtitle: Operations, Securities Division Operations, Equities Trading Services Operations, Associate (51430)
responsibilities: OPERATIONS Operations is a dynamic, multi-faceted division that partners with all parts of the firm to provide banking, securities, and asset management services to clients around the world. In addition, Operations provides essential risk management and controls to preserve and enhance the firm's assets and its reputation. For every new product launched and every trade executed, it is Operations that develops and manages the processes and controls that enable business flow. YOUR IMPACT¬† Are you looking to join a dynamic and fast paced team, applying your analytical and problem solving skills for maximum impact,¬†whilst deepening your knowledge of Equity Derivatives? Equity Trading Services is seeking a professional who is looking to partner¬†with our business and other internal and external stakeholders to provide market leading business enablement and risk and control¬†services.¬† OUR IMPACT¬† Our team of critical thinkers partners with groups in all areas of the firm to perform financial analytics, reporting, data analytics and¬†engineering. Our division also provides critical operations design and handles capital markets operations to ensure business flows¬†smoothly across our global offices. From day one, team members play a vital role in upholding the three Operations principles of¬†client focus, process innovation, and risk management.¬† Equity Trading Services provides front to back post-execution support to all equity based derivative activity in Asia. The Middle¬†Office team has critical focus on front office day to day risk and trading surveillance, new issuances, client service, corporate¬†actions processing and strategic firm and business infrastructure projects.¬†  Middle Office acts as first point of contact for the various Equities Trading desks, assisting in the execution of both new¬†client and hedging activity. Clients execute trades across a range of product wrappers e.g OTC, Securitised , Synthetic and it is¬†Middle Office‚Äôs responsibility to ensure positions are booked and maintained correctly in our risk systems. There is a strong¬†emphasis on knowledge and expertise which requires that all team members are fully versed in products and systems used as well¬†as the processes and procedures that must be followed when performing day to day tasks.¬†  HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL¬†  Prepare to gain a comprehensive understanding of the operational process lifecycle by interacting with internal and external¬†stakeholders including clients, trading desks, brokers, Sales, Structuring and other federation teams in order to work toward the¬†shared goal of business enablement and risk mitigation¬† Partner with a team of product experts to review all operational aspects of the trade flow while gaining strong technical knowledge,¬†risk control and commercial awareness¬† Use your inquisitive mind set to identify efficiency opportunities with respect to process flow methodology as well as enhance scalability¬† Leverage your quantitative skills to decompose complex regulatory and operational process requirement, and propose creative, robust solutions¬† Oversight & ownership of the full front to back operational flow ensuring that seamless execution of trades, new business and flow¬†enhancements¬†
requirements: SKILLS & EXPERIENCE WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR¬†  Ability to demonstrate a sound of understanding of a range of Equity Derivative products as well as Cash Securities. Strong Team-¬†working skills ‚Äì for working with both internal departments¬†and globally¬† Track record in the development of client relationships and key stakeholders, both internally and externally¬† Ability to gain a strong understanding of the business and work with Prime Brokerage, Marketing, Structuring, Trading and Sales¬†desks¬† Excellent communication and interpersonal skills¬† Ability to thrive under pressure¬† Strong leadership skills essential ‚Äì this role will require a self-starter who can manage competing deadlines and can prioritize¬†appropriately  ¬© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2019. All rights reserved,¬†Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.

responsibilities: About J.P. Morgan Chase & Co. JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.5 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small businesses, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world‚Äôs most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands.„ÄÄ Information about J.P. Morgan is available at¬†www.jpmorganchase.com Neovest is a wholly owned subsidiary of J.P. Morgan which provides a comprehensive suite of financial technology services to the buy and sell-side communities. Neovest's technology encompasses direct market access, advanced order management, real-time market data, and advanced analytics in a comprehensive and robust application, which includes advanced ECN and exchange aggregation, broker routing, crossing, and algorithmic order routing aggregation. Tightly integrated with these features is Neovest's industry leading analytics platform, which includes superior charting, quotes, news, filtering/reverse filtering, and full depth of book. Other Neovest features include basket/list trading, order slicing, options execution, portfolio/risk management, and allocation and bunching capabilities. ¬† ¬† ¬† We are currently looking to recruit a customer-facing Account Management position whose responsibilities will include analytic, order execution, IT, back office, FIX connectivity, customer service, internal sales, and trade support skill sets.¬† This is a highly visible opportunity to contribute to growth in electronic trading at the firm. The Account Manager ("AM") is responsible to represent the firm to clients in a first class way. It is essential that the AM forge a strong relationship with clients to develop implicit trust in the AM and their ability to service client needs. Clients should view their AM as a trusted partner and key contributor to their success. AMs must be highly proactive and take initiative to provide excellent service to clients. The company's products, along with the service component, should be an integral and highly valued part of our clients' business. Responsibilities:  Serve as primary point of contact for clients for all Neovest related issues. Communicate with and regularly visit clients, understand their needs, and develop a strong relationship with them. Manage client relationship through their lifecycle with the firm: product demonstrations, pre-sales technical consultation, on-boarding process, implementation / training, on-going support. Identify opportunities to up- and cross-sell additional Neovest products, asset classes, or global markets within the client firm. Responsible for individually managed account growth as well as departmental support contributions. Assist in project management details related to overall company improvement.

responsibilities: Punggol Digital District (PDD) is an upcoming mixed-use development that will house the key growth sectors of the digital economy such as cybersecurity and data analytics. It is also the first digital district in Singapore where we will integrate smart technologies horizontally on a single Open Digital Platform (ODP) to yield synergies across various technologies.¬†The ODP will become a reference digital architecture for future smart districts in Singapore and transform the way we work, live and play. Scope and Responsibilities   As a Solution Architect in the Smart District Division, you will be responsible to co-develop the end-to-end architecture of an Open Digital Platform (ODP) for Smart Districts with JTC‚Äôs strategic partners and partnering Government Agencies. The Solution Architect shall work with the technical leads from GovTech and CSA to ensure the detailed design and development of the ODP are aligned with the Whole of Government Technology Stack. Success in this role will be demonstrated by your strong technical aptitude, Business Sense and ability to communicate in an effective and efficient manner.¬†Demonstrate leadership in IT and Engineering management by producing strategic and innovative concept proposals, papers, and presentations.  Translate business requirements, including application resiliency requirements, into application architectural specifications Creates, evaluates and implements plans and design proposals for high impact solutions, considering key factors such as long-term effectiveness, practicality, technical limitations and criticality Manage technical project delivery; perform systems reviews and make recommendations of system and code changes; collaborate with development staff to resolve technical challenges; help to analyze and determine performance tuning and scalability improvements of code and queries Provide architecture and technical support during production Possesses broad and deep skills across disciplines, ability and interest in mentoring technical staff and raising collective technical competencies    Requirements   Graduate degree in any discipline   Minimum 7 years of design/implementation/consulting experience with distributed applications - must have a minimum of 3 years‚Äô hands-on experience as a technical lead and system architect (i.e. system design, performance tuning, and system prototyping & maintenance)   Experience in System Engineering Process.   Relevant Experience in Smart Systems development and deployment.  A solid software development background and multiple industry certifications Experience in Software Development. Solid understanding of Server-side, .Net and/or Java development, Service Oriented Architectures (SOA), web services and public web sites / digital services development Experience in designing, developing and deploying large, scalable production applications on cloud/PaaS platforms and Containers Working knowledge of DevOps software development tools and methodologies¬† Results and customer oriented¬† Team player with strong organization and interpersonal skills Strong written, presentation and stakeholder management skills

responsibilities: The Manager/Senior Manager uses data analytics and determines new strategies to make production processes more efficient to meet organisation's goals. He/She establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisation‚Äôs approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation.

jobtitle: Senior Audit Manager / Audit Manager (Part-time Contract)
responsibilities:
Responsibilities
Reporting to the Deputy Director (Audit & Advisory Division), you will:

Be involved in the preparation and update of the audit universe, audit work plan and risk assessment.
Coordinate the audits and prepare the Audit Planning Memorandum and Risk Control Matrix in line with the business and operational risk profile.
Carry out the audit of operational and financial processes to ascertain compliance with JTC/Agency and government rules and regulations, and report any discrepancies noted and improvements required.
Prepare clear and concise written reports to communicate audit results to management and make appropriate recommendations.
Contribute to the continuous improvement in audit methodology and processes.
Lead or support any investigation, including the preparation of the investigation report.
Undertake any non-audit projects (such as advisory or consultancy) to support JTC Corporation as a whole or other Agencies.

¬†
Requirements

Background in Accountancy and possess at least 5-8 year(s) of relevant audit working experience.
Possess strong analytical, communication and project management skills.
Having relevant certifications such as CPA/CA, CISA, CIA, CFE, and experience using data analytics (IDEA, ACL, SQL) and audit management¬†applications (Team Mate, MK Insight) would be an advantage.

He/She establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisation‚Äôs approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. company: SINGAPORE-MIT ALLIANCE FOR RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY CENTRE
responsibilities: Overview The Scientific Director will be a key member of an interdisciplinary research programme addressing key technology bottlenecks in cell therapy manufacturing: (i) critical quality attributes of safe, effective cell therapy products and (ii) integrated process analytics to monitor and modulate those attributes. While cell therapies are poised to transform healthcare for both the industry and the patient, there remain many outstanding scientific and technical challenges to significant global impact that this R&D programme addresses. This high-impact focus includes measurement and feedback control of processing parameters that contribute to cell viability and function during cell proliferation, and the measurement at intermediate and final steps of the cell product properties correlated with positive therapeutic outcomes. This interdisciplinary team comprises engineers, biologists, clinicians, and manufacturing experts from multiple MIT academic units, and multiple Singapore-based universities, research centers, and hospitals who are experienced at translational demonstrations of technologies in safety-regulated industries such as cell therapies. Our unique, enabling and cross-cutting capabilities include cell and clinical biology, microfluidics, real-time optics and spectroscopies, 3D-printed devices, process analytics, data analytics, and bioinformatics. This programme will demonstrate these approaches required of cell-based personalized medicine through three translational testbeds (three Flagship Projects), ultimately facilitating access for more patients to life-saving, approved cell therapies for currently intractable health challenges SMART seeks a Scientific Director with experience and expertise in cell therapy manufacturing.¬† She or he will: Responsibilities  Assist the Co-Lead Principal Investigators to support a team of investigators in executing technical scope and milestones of the program; Participate in a Council of co-investigators who will set scientific operation milestones and internal operation policies of an interdisciplinary research team and programme; Manage internal (within SMART Interdisciplinary Research Group) and external communications; Support external partnerships and collaborations with clinical, industrial, and regulatory stakeholders; Act as technical expert within the wider clinical and cell therapy production / commercialization landscape in Singapore and facilitate team awareness on potential opportunities, complementary efforts by other R&D teams, and emerging production challenges in industry and clinical settings; Act as a subject matter expert and provide consistent co-mentorship to postdoctoral and graduate student researchers in the program; Represent the research programme at meetings with governmental agencies, industry sponsors, or visitors;¬† Oversee financial administration of the program; and Perform other related duties as required.
requirements: Ph.D. in Biology, Chemistry, Biological Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Cell Biology, or Biophysics; Biopharmaceutical experience, particularly with experience in industry, clinical, and/or manufacturing settings; At least 3 years‚Äô experience in research management in a medium/large scale research center or industry; Demonstrated ability to build strategic collaborations to strengthen and enhance the research projects; Proven ability to manage complex, multi-stakeholder programs; Excellent written / verbal communication skills; and MIT alumnus/alumna or previous MIT or SMART research appointment preferred.  ¬† Interested applicants will have to submit their full CV (including papers published, patents filed, etc.), a cover letter, a research leadership statement (2 pages), and list of three references (to include reference names and contact information). We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

You will simplify complex ideas and present them to clients in an easy to understand and impactful way. ¬† We pride ourselves on our strong supportive team culture and diverse mix of backgrounds. We also strongly believe in the importance of potential and desire to learn. As such is it important to us that you fit well within our team, have a strong desire to learn and develop your own skills and also support and coach others. ¬† In return for joining our team, you will gain exposure to a wide range of industry clients, and be rewarded with a career built on a variety of experiences, and the opportunity for senior leadership development within our firm. We will also provide you the opportunity to develop a global network of contacts across PwC who will support you in your growth as a leader, consultant and analytics professional. ¬† Below are the qualities we look for in candidates, but don‚Äôt be discouraged if you don‚Äôt possess all or even most of them. We would still love to talk to you about joining our team. ¬† To be successful in this role a candidate will ideally have some of the following domain and content skills:  7+ years of experience including 2+ years of consulting experience A natural ability to engage and communicate with clients to understand their needs and unique challenges Demonstrated experience reviewing current state system architectures and designing future state roadmaps Experience advising on advanced analytic technologies such as such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Docker, Zeppelin, Cassandra or similar and experience with Cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS or Google Cloud Experience advising on advanced analytic workbenches and self-service tools such as Qlik or Tableau Knowledge of best practice data management and data/information governance frameworks Experience designing and working with traditional Enterprise Data Warehouse architectures and solutions, and knowledge of more modern concepts such as Data Lakes and the patterns to establish both or hybrid Experience with enterprise BI platforms such as BusinessObjects and Cognos or similar  ¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† ¬†
requirements: A desire and ability to think abstractly, solve problems and deal with ambiguity  The agility to adapt and apply new and varied analytical solutions to client opportunities that may arise Enthusiasm and drive to be a leader in our team, helping shape and develop its future Strong communication, presentation, project management and time management skills A degree in a quantitative discipline, such as maths/stats, computer science or engineering  ¬† If you are interested in taking on real business challenges and believe you have the energy, initiative and skill to join our team then please apply.

administration of the department   Other duties as and when assigned

company: INTEGRATED HEALTH INFORMATION SYSTEMS PTE. LTD.
responsibilities: The Data Management Lead / Data Architect designs data structure and architecture, master/meta-data management approach and data quality programme to facilitate access to data and information. He/She works with end users to design, implement and oversee maintenance of data flow channels and data processing systems that support the collection, storage, batch and real-time processing, and analysis of information from structured and unstructured sources in a scalable, repeatable and secure manner. He/She develops data management standards and practices. Responsibilities:  Segment users by their information seeking behaviour and design data management approach that meets their needs Identify the desired state of coordinated data and information flow through the organisation Collaborate with stakeholders to understand needs for data structure, availability, scalability and accessibility Provide thought leadership to stakeholders in determining which data management techniques and solutions will enable the enterprise to achieve defined business goals Design the data flow channels and processing systems to extract, transform, load and integrate data from various sources¬† Lead the development of complex code, scripts and data pipelines to process structured and unstructured data in near real-time¬† Supervise the development of prototypes and proof of concepts for the selected solutions¬† Research hardware and software needs to support selected solutions Lead the development of tools to improve data flows between internal/external systems and the data lake/warehouse¬† Define data retention policies Maintain knowledge of existing and emerging data management principles/theories/techniques Provide advice on high-level Data Management or Big Data Analytics solution designs. Evaluate technologies/services, providing regular reporting on emerging trends, value add information and potential impact to the healthcare landscape.
requirements: Minimum 10 years of experience in delivering data warehouse or advanced analytics solutions, especially in designing large Big Data technologies or analytics solutions. Minimum 5 years of relevant hands-on experience in delivering end-to-end industry analytics solutions, from conceptualisation to deployment, within the industry. Demonstrate good, in-depth knowledge in Big Data hardware/software products, frameworks and methodologies. Degree/Master in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering or equivalent. Experience with¬†     big data techniques and solutions (e.g. Hadoop, MapReduce, Hive) databases (e.g. Oracle, DB2, MS SQL, MySQL, Teradata, Greenplum) data repository design (e.g. operational data stores, dimensional data stores, data marts) data interrogation techniques (e.g. SQL, NoSQL). real-time structured and unstructured data storage and ingestion. data quality tools and processes. data transformation and terminology equivalence mapping. data modelling for analytics (e.g. star schemas, snowflake schemas).   Comfortable working with and staffing senior management, proficient in usage of Office Productivity Suite Software (e.g. Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint, etc). Possess good verbal and written communication, analytical and conflict resolution skills with proven ability to translate complex, technical subjects into clear and concise communications to a variety of key stakeholders of different levels Strong ability to handle ambiguity and high work pressure. Versatile in working independently as well as an effective team player. Good knowledge of various analytics systems/applications and outputs within healthcare industry domains will be advantageous.

jobtitle: IT Developer ( 1 year convertible to perm)
responsibilities: KPMG in Singapore is part of a global network of professional services firms providing Audit, Tax and Advisory services. With 200,00 outstanding professionals in the network working together to deliver value in 154 countries and territories, we offer a globally-consistent standard of service based on professional capabilities, industry insight and local knowledge. In the ASEAN region, KPMG member firms operate across all 10 countries. Our industry focus helps KPMG firms‚Äô professionals develop a rich understanding of clients' businesses and the insight, skills and resources required to address industry-specific issues and opportunities. ¬† We invite highly motivated, dynamic professionals to join our growing Technology Solutions & Innovation team. The Technology Solutions and Innovation team within KPMG Information Technology Services is dedicated to creating and delivering value to our business by leveraging on IT technology. The team is responsible for delivering customer-focused solutions and high quality IT services internally to enable our business. The role involves:  Manages and perform end to end Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) of the Information System Projects. Troubleshoots, improves and upgrades existing applications. responsibilities: Position Temporary Staff to support the administration of the Home Team Foundation Course ¬† Background The Centre for Home Team Foundation Training and Heritage of the Home Team Academy, Ministry of Home Affairs is searching for a temporary staff to provide administrative support for the implementation of the Home Team Foundation Course (HTFC). ¬† The HTFC is a two-week residential programme and will serve as a key milestone course to build a One Home Team mindset for all the new-entrant Home Team Senior Officers. The HTFC will support Home Team Transformation 2025 by exposing its participants to the Home Team‚Äôs challenges, sharing how the Home Team is transforming to meet these challenges, and equipping them with cross-cutting skills such as data analytics. Through its experiential elements and learning visits, the HTFC also seeks to strengthen the Home Team culture and foster camaraderie through shared experiences and ethos. All new-entrant Home Team Senior Officers are required to attend the HTFC within one year of passing out from their respective Home Team Department‚Äôs basic courses. There are 10 runs of the HTFC expected in a calendar year. ¬† Job Responsibilities 1. To assist in the submission of budget requirements and monitoring of expenditure for the course; 2. To procure in bulk, the personal-issued items such as course attire; 3. To work with respective Home Team Departments on the nomination of course participants; 4. To procure and manage the transportation services for learning visits; 8.
