To procure and prepare course-related materials such as stationery, certificates, certificate holders, course photographs and journals; 10. To ensure that the layout plans are in accordance to the conduct of lessons; 11. To work with Training Safety and Assessment Branch, HTA on the training safety aspects such as preparation of risk assessment forms for outdoor activities; 12. To procure and work with Corporate Services, HTA on the accommodation arrangement such as cleaning services for rooms and linen; 13. To work with Security Branch, HTA and partner agencies on security-related issues e.g. security clearance; and 14. To assist in the preparation and administering of course assessment; 15. To arrange for photo-taking of key activities such as fireside chats and group photo 16. To prepare certificates for participants, including editing and printing of group photo and certificates 17. To procure and manage the team building activity 18. To administer and consolidate all the module and course feedback; 19. To assist in report generation of collated data for further analysis; and 20. Other duties as directed by the HTFC Course Manager. ¬† Job Requirements: 1. Experience in government procurement processes; 2. Experience in supporting events for senior management; 3. Self-driven, able to work independently or in teams, manage multiple task and tight deadlines; 4. Proficient in Microsoft Office; 5. Strong interpersonal, verbal and communication skills; and 6. Willing to commit a minimum of 11 months consisting of five-days work week.

responsibilities: Information Technology Risk Management and Security has become an essential component of the current IT enterprise that provides IT & Automation support to the Pharmaceutical Research, Supply Chain and Marketing organizations.¬† Increased risks in both the information security (e.g. cyber threats, malware, etc.) and the regulated areas have required that staff possessing such skills is fully embedded within the IT organization.¬† The enterprise is now dependent on these security and compliance experts for identifying, escalating and remediating such IT Risks in a timely and efficient manner.¬† Also, emerging technologies like cloud, mobility and data analytics require strong IT Risk and Compliance early involvement. ¬† The Vulnerability Management (VM) Analyst Position is responsible for helping to safeguard the company's assets, intellectual property, and computer systems in support of the company's business objectives. The applicant will be responsible for detecting vulnerabilities, researching potential impact to the organization, and communicating the risks to senior VM team members. The VM Analyst works among a team of skilled analysts to address complex or difficult problems as needed within a 24/7 Cyber Security Fusion Center environment.¬† ¬† ¬† Primary Job responsibilities ‚Ä¢ Perform scans to identify vulnerabilities or confirm compliance to security standards. ‚Ä¢ Maintain patch and vulnerability management practices to protect against the exploitation of critical vulnerabilities. ‚Ä¢ Facilitate vulnerability remediation efforts through cross Business & IT functions. ‚Ä¢ Apply knowledge of operating systems, applications, and database vulnerability assessments (to include system configuration checks) on various Information Systems. ‚Ä¢ Interpret vulnerability assessment results and report findings to senior VM staff as well as recommendations for remediation. ‚Ä¢ Conduct research on current vulnerabilities and exploits using publicly available, trusted resources and other finished vulnerability products. ‚Ä¢ Implement and utilize a combination of automated tools (e.g., Nessus, Tanium) and manual checks to identify and validate vulnerabilities.¬†
requirements: ‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs Degree¬† in Information Security, Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience. ‚Ä¢ 2-4 years of computer and network security experience preferred ‚Ä¢ Thorough understanding of fundamental security and network concepts (operating systems, IPS/IDS, TCP/IP, ports, etc.) ‚Ä¢ Demonstrated analytic expertise ‚Äì to include ability to think critically and logically in a dynamic, high-pressure, fast-paced environment ‚Ä¢ Identify operational roadblocks to ensure timely remediation and countermeasures ¬† Preferred : ‚Ä¢ 1-2 years of experience in vulnerability management, penetration testing or software development.¬† ‚Ä¢ Experience with Microsoft and Unix-based operating systems ‚Ä¢ Experience managing and tracking vulnerability cases ‚Ä¢ Experience supporting network security investigations ‚Ä¢ GCIA, GCIH, CSX, Security +, Network + or similar security certification.

jobtitle: Sr. Associate, Strategy & Planning - International Business Development
responsibilities: About the Role We‚Äôre changing the way people think about transportation. Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now we‚Äôre a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether it‚Äôs a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it. For the people who drive with Uber, our app represents a flexible new way to earn money. For cities, we help strengthen local economies, improve access to transportation, and make streets safer. And that‚Äôs just what we‚Äôre doing today. We‚Äôre thinking about the future, too. With teams working on new modalities, self-driving cars and even urban air transportation, we‚Äôre in for the long haul. We‚Äôre reimagining how people and things move from one place to the next. What You‚Äôll Do  Develop global and regional business development strategy, including opportunity sizing and prioritization of resources (BD, Product, Operations, Marketing) in collaboration with the Heads of Business Development Strategy & Planning Evaluate partnership opportunities across several industries, performing a broad range of quantitative and qualitative analyses Drive team accountability by managing the deal pipeline and review process, ensuring deals serve company strategy, accounting for risk appropriately, monitoring competitive developments, and conducting impact assessments / readouts in collaboration with the data analytics team Routinely present results of financial modeling and analysis and act as a thought partner to various Business Development team leads globally Interface with external executives alongside seasoned Business Development professionals to forge complex deals and relationships
requirements: What We're Looking for  3 - 6 years as an analyst at a leading investment bank, private equity, consulting firm, or tech company in an analytical role Highly analytical with strong financial modeling and complex problem solving skills Effective oral and written communication skills Familiarity collaborating with and presenting to senior executives Ability to work in cross functional teams (Business Development, Legal, Finance, Accounting, etc.) Ability to multi-task and deal with time pressure in an unstructured environment; ability to work through uncertainty Undergraduate degree from a top school, with demonstrated strong academic performance SQL capability or willingness to learn is a plus

responsibilities:
Punggol Digital District (PDD) is an upcoming mixed-use development that will house the key growth sectors of the digital economy such as cybersecurity and data analytics. It is also the first digital district in Singapore where we will integrate smart technologies horizontally on a single Open Digital Platform (ODP) to yield synergies across various technologies.¬†The ODP will become a reference digital architecture for future smart districts in Singapore and transform the way we work, live and play.
What to Expect:¬†
As a cybersecurity specialist in the Smart District Division, you will support the development of an Open Digital Platform (ODP) to integrate smart estate technologies horizontally on a single platform. The role requires you to work with industry partners and other Government Agencies, such as CSA and GovTech, to incorporate infrastructure and application cybersecurity requirements into the design, build and operation of the ODP.
During the initial phase of the project you will need to work with the project team to identify cybersecurity requirements and concerns, and design/propose workable solutions. Subsequently you will move into the DevSecOps role to work with the software development team to develop security modules that are required to secure the ODP.
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Develop, maintain and operate software security modules required to secure the ODP.
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Design Security Workflow including security risk detection, resolution and governance reporting.
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Ensure overall project security design is relevant and fit for purpose.
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Deploy cyber security products within the ODP.
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Coordinate with various partners to test and evaluate the effectiveness of security solutions including laboratory setup and proof-of-concept testing.
¬†
How to Succeed:
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Bachelor's degree computer science/ engineering or related field
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience with Software as a Service (SaaS) platforms.
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Expertise in key infrastructure and application cybersecurity technologies and standards such as AES, PKI, Twofish, TPM, 2FA technologies, NIST Standards etc.
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Candidates with security certifications such as SANS GSEC, (ISC)2 CISSP or training certificates in security products are preferred

responsibilities:
GovTech is tasked with harnessing info-communications technology and related engineering for public sector transformation.¬†The Governance Group within GovTech designs and implements progressive policies that continuously raise the technology standards and¬†respond to the ever-changing nature of security threats. The group has also put in place an effective compliance framework and works with all government agencies to achieve this.
If you are someone with strong IT audit and compliance background and passionate about technology, looking for opportunities to work with a team of practitioners and leading industry experts, we welcome you to join the Governance Group.
As¬†Director, Audit and Compliance, you will be managing a team of audit professionals and tasked to lead the whole-of-government (WOG) IT audit and compliance management, covering over 100 government agencies.
¬†
What to Expect:

Oversee all interactions with agencies, including briefings, audit fieldwork, management responses and follow-up actions to ensure timely execution of audit workplans.
Plan, develop and conduct annual IT policy compliance and process audits, as well as technical audits on critical systems and infrastructure.
Review audit findings and assess agencies‚Äô and whole-of-government overall state of compliance and risks.
Formulate mitigation plans and recommendations to improve state of IT compliance.
Prepare and implement development plans to build internal capability in IT audit and compliance management.
Plan, source and actively manage outsourced augmentation of internal capability, to deliver the committed deliverables.
Promote best practices and raise organizational awareness on matters relating to Governance, Risk and Compliance.
Undertake any ad-hoc projects or special reviews, which may include investigation, due diligence and advisory.
Driving and implementing transformation projects via pilot project, proof-of-concepts and build prototypes, especially in the area of continuous/anticipate auditing, and data analytics.

¬†
How to Succeed:

Has tertiary qualifications in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology or other related discipline.
Possess professional certifications such as CIA and CISA.
Has minimally 20 years‚Äô ICT experience, preferably with at least 10 years in ICT audit and/or compliance management positions.
Strong understanding of IT management, technology and operations.
Prior experience leading audit teams and conducting audit fieldwork and has good working knowledge and understanding of regulatory compliance, governance and internal controls.
Possess strong leadership, negotiation and collaboration skills; able to interact with all levels of the organization.
Experience in driving successful implementation of IT Audit-related transformation projects is highly desirable.
Good written and verbal communication and presentation skills.

responsibilities: MHA S&T Associate Programme The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) aspires to be a world-class organisation in delivering safety and security for our people. In pursuing our mission to make Singapore our Safe and Secure Best Home, we remain always constant and true to our core values of Honour and Unity. The MHA Science &Technology (S&T) Associate Programme is a programme designed for STEM graduates with less than 3 years of work experience who are keen to improve Singapore‚Äôs Safety & Security. ¬† What we offer: As an S&T Associate, you will specialise in domains critical to safeguarding national security such as : (a)Forensics, (b) Chemical, Biological, Radiological, Nuclear and Explosives (CBRNE), (c)Biometrics & Profiling, (d)Sense-making & Surveillance, (e)Cybersecurity, (f)Data Analytics & Artificial Intelligence and (f) Robotics and Automation. Associates will take on challenging projects in these domains under the guidance of Senior Domain Practitioners and lead one greenfield project to build up your portfolio.¬† As you work with our Home Team Departments (e.g. SPF, SCDF, SPS, CNB, ICA, HTA), you will apply Science & Technology expertise to address safety and security challenges for Singapore.¬† You will also benefit from professional development opportunities including training and overseas learning trips. In addition, each S&T Associate will be personally mentored by a Senior Management Mentor. To better understand the types of Science & Technology work undertaken by the Home Team, please click here. ¬† We are looking for:  Applicants with STEM disciplines/background preferred Applicants who have completed internships, projects or personal achievements which reflect a passion for Science & Technology Work Applicants who possess skills relevant to the S&T Domains Applicants who are technologically savvy and collaborative  ¬† Join us:The application for the MHA S&T Associate Programme is open all year round. When submitting your CV and other relevant documents for the application, please also upload a separate MS word file indicating:  Your top 3 preferences for specialisation out of these 11 domains in rank order: (a)Forensics, (b)Chemical, Biological, Radiological, Nuclear and Explosives (CBRNE), (c)Biometrics & Profiling, (d)Sense-making & Surveillance, (e)Cybersecurity, (f)Data Analytics & Artificial Intelligence, (g) Robotics & Automation, (h) Command, Control, Communications, Computers & Intelligence (C4i), (i)Platforms, vehicles and weapons, (j) Protective Security and (k)Human Factors. A short write-up of your passion for Science and/or Technology with specific examples of internships, projects, hackathons, other personal hobbies and tech skill-sets you possess.  ¬†
